Infinity War was fantastic, I expected End Game to top it but it was.... very disappointing to say the least. Thor a beer drinking slob. Hulk a teddy bear. Ant-Man accidentally saved by a rat walking over some buttons. Iron Man figuring out time travel in a single day.The movie was obviously promoting woman as the heroes, the men were weak and emotional wussies overall.Lesbian captain Marvel could have ended everything in the blink of an eye but she just left in the beginning of the movie only to return to take down the entire alien force spaceship in 3 seconds yet she couldn't take on Thanos who knocked her out with one blow. Thanos who was killed without any effort in the beginning of the movie mind you. Thanos from before Infinity War was killed in the future yet everything still happened. Nebula killed her past self yet still existed. Captain America deciding to stay in the past yet reappearing in the same timeline. Thor taking the hammer from his past leaving his original self without one? People picking up infinity stones like they were regular stones. It made no sense at all.The death of the two avengers triggered no emotional response with me and it's pretty easy to make me cry with emotional scenes, this did nothing to me. I found myself sympathizing more with Thanos, the villain in this story who actually seemed like a pretty nice guy trying to cleanup the mess in the universe than these "heroes" who only wanted to get their family members and friends back.

Avengers: Endgame (2019)
BROKE MY SCALE 20/10"A finale so masterfully constructed, Avengers: Endgame proves to us that a finale WILL do whatever it takes to treat the fans with an emotionally moving, action-packed masterpiece."I am just blown away by how well Endgame does for itself. My expectations were stacked, and the film somehow managed to surpass those expectations. Like Infinity War, Endgame manages to strategically balance the humor with the seriousness of specific aspects, you'll either be laughing or crying, or both at certain points. The action still stands out as a fair product of entertainment, going to the extremity of any situation, no matter how impossible it may have seemed; taking risky moves to get the film's point across the table. Lastly, the characters are so well written in this, sometimes its just hard to believe that our original heroes conclude their stories in this tearjerking finale; it really is hard to say goodbye sometimes when we've grown on these characters since day one. I can even say that Thanos' character is basically given the upgrade in sociopathic motive, making him somewhat unpredictable just like the predecessor. The film does have its minimalistic flaws (like any other film) but I felt that these flaws are completely ineffective towards the the whole idea of what points the film intends to display.Verdict: Avengers: Endgame marks the end of an era that lasted 11 years. It concludes a story so fashionably well, its safe to say to bring the tissue and bring the applause, because there's no way in hell anyone was prepared for this epic finale.
One more thing, I'd like to thank everyone who was involved in the making of Endgame (especially the Russo Brothers), and anyone who contributed to the build up to this conclusion we've all waited for. And a final thank you to the man himself, Stan Lee, for showing us that the real heroes are the fans because WE made it happen. May he rest in peace, thank you for reading folks.

I wanted to like this, but it's tough ask when it recycles so much it felt almost parody like. A key character's death is dealt with almost flippantly on two occasions, the main story action is not great and feels re-hashed. It felt like a lukewarm follow up film so in hopes no-one notices it just throws every character at it in the closing section going for epic but it just felt a bloated mess.In the battle for screen time ego it's clear who comes out on top but this isn't an Iron Man film and shouldn't have been. Concentrating on the wrong characters led this down the wrong path. It should have been called Avengers: Inevitable.

I am still trying to put together what I truly felt about this movie. It is so long, large and grand that everytime I focus on some aspect I realise new elements I like or dislike.To some extent this is key to the problem. I found the first part of the movie enjoyable, both on entertainment but also in regards to the expectations one has to "the end of an era".It tries so hard to cover every aspect of the world that I felt that it was waaaaay to obvious in the story. Regarding this I truly feel like the movie would be better with two parts of equal length.Throughout the entire movie I felt like it took every expected turn it could. Sure it tries to throw you curve balls, but when you on hindsight think about it you never really get surprised. At least not to the scale and seriousness they delivered in the last movie.But as the second part of the movie hit and the final showdown started I immediately felt wronged. And what a downfall it would be.I know that marvel is a moneygrabbing greed machine that does its best to stay within the largest group of viewers expectations. They cater to the easy masses at EVERY turn and never does anything that would trigger a person.Captain Marvell was bodyshaming in her movie? Let's make her look like an angry feminist at a rally.To many men? Let's take every woman in the marvel universe and desperately focus on them. Even when it is forced, unneeded and strained. Cram it into the same shot and just do it.Are the white men to powerfull and good-looking? Just wait until you see what they do to Thor.Need army able to take on any enemy possible, without any superpower? Just add wakanda..But what brave strong nordic warrior should take up the mantles of king of Asgard? Sure as hell not a nordic warrior..The list goes on and trust me.. every incel triggered "man*, WOMEN or attack helicopter must be catered to.

First of all, visually this is amazing movie. I saw it in Imax 3d and i feared i will not enjoy it , because action movies with fast scenes dont feel so good in 3d, but because of its slower pace, one could really enjoy the scenery, especially the space scenes. I generally liked the plot(going back in time etc), although there are serious holes in the plot but whatever, its a comic book fantasy movie so anything goes, right. Going back and revisiting crucial moments was also done very well,funny and reminding of all the other great MCU movies, it really tied up everything well. There was not so many obvious jokes, but still few good funny moments.
The downside for me is how I never can understand how this superheros match their powers - like in the beginning, Captain Marvel grabs Thanos, Thor slices him up like a chunk of butter,. but on the end fight, she cannot get to him, and Thor fights him both with his axe and hammer, plus Captain America and Iron-man and they cannot do anything to him. Thanos has some strange looking blade which is obviously much stronger than all their weapons , and Captain Marvel. So this really bothers me even in the previous movies, is like the script writers can write whatever they want and anything goes, right. Again you can see, I can tolerate so much BS until i start to get bored and feel like i dont have an IQ less then 80 or im 12 years old.
I dont see why it had to be 3 hour long, they could easily cut down the drama BS and make it 2.5h. Also, I am really really sad that Black Widow is gone - she was the best for me, a true hero without any gadgets, super powers or powerful weapons. And finally, its sad that all american series and movies put a lot of point on the characters making a drama , fuss and blaming each other - adults and especially super heroes should be more balanced - and that was Natasha's part in the MCU, she was always so rational and calm .
I will watch this once more it comes out on Bluray but i dont i will be coming back more then that. Unlike the first Avangers, or even Infinity war..

Good dammit.

There's a moment in one of Scream franchise openings that a girl makes a comment about the Stab franchise (the movie series within the movie). She says that even Stab series used time traveling because that's what they do when there's nothing else to tell.Funny enough, some of the Avengers makes a quite similar observation when Ant Man comes with this cliche idea. That was exactly the moment that I did remember that quote from Scream. And I couldn't expect anything different from that on.Infinity War was an amazing movie, first because it gave us all the feeling that heroes can fall, and villains can be more than just bad guys without purpose.Thanos is a villain because he was created that way, but his vision about the world and universe are unique and makes sense in his mind. When he snap his fingers and random people start disappearing, Infinity War made its point.At first, Infinity War was to be a movie divided in two parts, and the second part being the consequences and resolutions about the world after Thanos. A new era was about to be born, but suddenly it was stated that the 4th movie wouldn't be that way anymore.After finally watching Endgame, the reasons for that changes are very clear to me.First thing is that most of the fans couldn't stand the fact that some heroes have died, so writers had to think about a differet resolution to please them. Second is that Marvel failed to use it as an element of surprise to Endgame.What we see during 3 hours is an empty movie struggling to keep the pace of an entire cinematic universe created throughout a decade.As a whole, Endgame is only a redone version of Infinity War, and not exactly a follow up as it might seems. The consequences and resolutions are redundant when compared to the tragic ending of previous one. And yes, the time travelling plot was nothing else but a comfort zone to retell a story in a simpler way for the sake of a true ending.So, the clueless girl from Scream was right.Endgame had much more to tell than the way it was done. The plot development could have had dozen of different paths, and each one would have been much more interesting and still satisfying.I really don't understand how this movie became the biggest box office in history, because together with Age Of Ultron, is the weakest movie of the entire saga and entire MCU.

I'll start out by saying that overall the film was enjoyable and I did leave the theater with a certain sense of satisfaction. However, when you recap films in your head afterward and reminisce in your favorite moments I found myself going, wait....that doesn't make any sense...why did they do that????They completely trashed Thor and Hulk. They turned the Hulk into a geeky professor that could barely smash anything anymore They turned Thor into a self pitying drunk. Why? Thor has been through worse than this and yet now he's all of the sudden feeling so down on luck and depressed with life? This makes no sense. He's lost his mother, father, brother, home planet for pete's sake...he's been through worse! Why did they need to destroy Thor's character? And Hulk. I really enjoying seeing Hulk smash things. They turned him into more of a geeky old man than a brute.What the heck was the point of Captain Marvel in this movie? She had what....10 minutes screen time in the entire movie? It felt like the Captain Marvel movie was a 1 billion dollar GOTCHA from Marvel after watching this film. I was thoroughly dissapointed that we didn't get to see some sort of blockbuster fight scene between Captain Marvel and Thanos. At first she completely slaughters the mother ship in two quick flights. Then all the sudden she gets slapped across the screen like a tiny child? Seriously? She's more powerful than that! You gave yourself a powerful character with the Captain Marvel movie...do something with it!I am dissapointed that I won't get to replay happy film memories in the coming years. Overall, I think I got my money's worth with the film but I do feel like the directors royally dropped the ball. It felt like they did a really good job with Infinity War and then they realized that they dug themselves into a really deep hole that they couldn't direct themselves out of so they pieced this film together at the last second....

Time traveling cliché... At the end of the last part I wished that this part would not be a "Back to the future" kind of plot. I mean, it could be more... Um.. Coherent. In addition, the unexpected quick pace of events. The time traveling plot is so controversial, you can't just make your own theory of time traveling and shove it down our throats. In conclusion, it was a fun movie but as a fan, sorry, you could've done it better.

Then he come back at old age just to tell falcon to hold the shield.. wth.. lame..Dont believe the hype, honestly from me that you will be yawning in the cinema for this movie.. Incomparable to infinity war which is by far the best Marvel movie ever.. I give only 1 star because great action scene.

Another fun movie to watch
4/10 for sure (imdb makes us compare this movie to godfather)
I just don't see any difference between this nice popcorn movie and others like ninja turtles, transformers and GI joe!
fun to watch but plz don't give it an oscar!!!!

The movie was enjoyable but it has way too many plot holes.I personally think Avengers Infinity War is better than this.It felt like this movie is too much of a try hard to impress the fans...rushing the plot in the end.It left a bitter taste.

Marvel keeps raising the stakes to impossibly huge proportions, catering to fans with winks and nods because they know they're guaranteed ticket sales from fanboys/girls who just want to catch every Easter egg. This isn't good storytelling at all. The bigger the villains are, the bigger and more overpowered the heroes have to be (Vision, Captain Marvel, Cap swinging Mjolnir, etc) or the more characters they have to cram into the film. Endgame did both! Wow! I'm done seeing Marvel movies.Things I genuinely enjoyed:Hawkeye. I would've watched this movie if it was JUST a Hawkeye movie. Badass. In fact, I think that would've been a really cool way to handle the Decimation aftermath and Endgame in general. Challenging, maybe impossible, but cool.Black Widow. A female character who's somewhat complex and doesn't have unexplainably magical powers to conveniently save the day (looking at you, Danvers). Also, somehow her relationship with Clint is just platonic (or is it, because of the implications of the sacrifice? But honestly, Clint's already lost everything else so it's a moot point). This is cool, since the bombshell is normally "required" to have a romantic relationship in every movie, and here she doesn't.Lebowski Thor. Especially his sweaters, and the fact that Tony Stark actually made a joke that adults like myself find funny. Wow. It's been a running joke that Hemsworth's contract includes a shirtless scene clause as the stereotypical hunk. This was delightfully subverted.

Summary: A terrible movie that should go down in history as the worst Marvel movie of all time. For me personally, the Marvel journey ended with Infinity War, and what the Russo Brothers tried to do with End Game is an insult to all the Fans.----Spoilers ahead----
The Plot/Script: with 3 hours you would expected a well structured story, yet the movie was rushed. As soon as the movie starts you will notice that the flow is not right, they skipped through Tony and Nebula's situation way too fast, going after Thanos the first time, figuring out time travel, obtaining the soul stone...so many Plot holes, from time travelling, to heroes powers, EVERYTHING just seemed chaotic and wrongly put together.Hulk: they introduce Professor Hulk which at first you would think would be a great idea, but the execution was terrible. From one of the strongest Super Heroes to a Shrek look a like character, who basically did nothing for 3 hoursThor: They disrespected this character...it was just sad to see what they did to him. Thor set the bar high in Ragnarok and Infinity War as probably the greatest Marvel character yet, they destroyed him in this movie...Iron Man: The one who started it all, and for poetic justice they wanted it to end with him, and it seems only fair....how it was executed though was plain ridiculous and didn't make sense. First of all creating a gauntlet in Infinity War showcased how hard it is to do so, yet the Avengers did it so easily with Stark's technology. Secondly, Tony stealing the stones right out of Thanos arms was .....and to top it all of, Iron Man being able to actually put on all the stones and be able to withstand the power of what most creatures cannot...(Hulk being able to do that could make sense)Forced comedy: Marvel did not learn from Justice League, when you try to force comedy to what should have been a serious movie, you will end up with a really...bad movie.
This movie was more boring than all the other avengers. Its way too long. There's no action until the 3rd hour. Hated the force seens to push current agendas.

Overlong and cheesy in the extreme. As a massive Avengers fan I was disappointed in the film. Who on earth decided to portray Thor as an overweight bloated drunkard?..That person should be hit with Thor's hammer. In a way I am glad that it has come to an end. It had become a money making machine at the expense of high octane adventure. Yes I will miss it but maybe not as much as I should!!!

Endgame was a big disappointment for me and my wife. Too long, it belaboured the storyline unnecessarily, Iron Man (RDJ) was the saving grace, the action was NOT impressive, THOR has been totally wasted and destroyed and so was his charisma, too much time was wasted on Time Travel research. Scarlet Witch wasted as before (Olsen was good in her scenes though) and the worst part Thor's belly and his hammers were being lifted by everybody - first Hela, then Groot, Vision, Captain America and then Thanos?? This was stupid. And Vision the most powerful and a real leader of the Avengers has been given a very weak personality and was nowhere to be seen in the Endgame. This was a stupid end to a good phase. Infinity War was much superior as a movie.

I honestly think all these reason make no sense, EVEN within the Avengers world:Captain Marvel can negate the desperation of Stark and Nebula's situation and fly an entire spaceship to earth without any effort.Captain Marvel explains she has to attend to other matters. What is more important than Avengers' mission? She should have been summoned immediately when there was even the slightest opportunity to undo Thanos' snap. Why not give the Avengers a new pager?Thanos is almost immediately destroyed when they find him. A cool battle scene would have gotten the movie off to a better start.5 years later....Ant man is brought back by a rat.Ant man's daughter seems to have aged more than 5 years.Thor is a beer belly de-masculined moron and never gets back in shape. Such a waste. It would be like watching a Rocky movie where Rocky never really fights.Tony Stark can invent a time machine in a few minutes but still does his own dishes. Why not use the 5 year time gap to explain this more logically even within the suspend your believes Avengers world.We now are in an MCU where time travel (without an infinity stone) was invented.Time Travel also means instant space wherever you want to go travel. So many opportunities to get the infinity stones straight from Thanos surely. Why not get them just before he destroyed them instead since they know the date and they know he is alone? Their first mission in the movie was based on going there with the knowledge he still had the working stones AND they had Captain Marvel on their side. Why not try this for real first when time travel is available instead of big problems they will inevitably run into (running into themselves etc)?Weird Time Travel rules to explain why they can't destroy Thanos as a baby but a lot of these rules make no sense considering what happens (old Captain America).Nebula doesn't tell Hawkeye and Black Widow about the soul stone sacrifice.The second soul stone "sacrifice" is nowhere near as dramatic as in the first movie. Even the same music is used though.The Hulk/Banner is still useless and never gets his revenge fight with Thanos. What a waste.Time travel is not like Back To The Future at all .... but it is. But Back To The Future 2 handles past events from the previous movie better. It shows the highlights, here we get some background stuff (elevator ride in 2012 etc). There was a better movie I reckon if they had to collect 6 stones from major events from the previous movies and get involved in these more.Thanos is a bumbling idiot who now wants to destroy the entire universe and start again rather than his far more reasoned mission in IW.Thanos doesn't need the stones to be immensely powerful.Captain America brings the infinity stones back (also the soul stone?) with a briefcase.Stark can place all the stones in his nano suit without anything happening to him (compare to Thanos getting each stone). But yet it destroys Stark if he uses all the stones.Gomaro knees Quill in the nuts. So stupid and heartless. Quill - Gamora relationship is erased. It feels like the Data 2 approach in Stark Trek.Gamora is mostly absent from the movie even though she played probably one of the most major parts in IW after Thanos. She's not even at Stark's funeral. No one cares.Captain America can use Mjolnir.Even with both Mjolnir and Stormbreaker Thor is of not much good even though he almost single handedly destroyed Thanos' army with Stormbreaker in IW.Seeing the snapped superheroes come back was cool but was left very late. Also we didn't really see the implications of normal humans coming back.Peter Parker and all his classmates (some unsnapped I assume) still in high school 5 years later.The 5 year time gap would cause so many problems. Where did people snap back? At their homes if they were in a plane? What if their unsnapped loved one was living with someone else by then? I really think the only way to have gone with this movie is if the unsnap happened straight away or the original unsnap was prevented.Younger Nebula can use the time machine to get Thanos and his army into the Future. Why can't older Nebula immediately send them billions years into the past where they would burn up in a young universe.Many individuals without physical power were on the battlefield including Mantis I believe. So weird.With the time infinity stone Dr. Strange surely could reverse Stark's death.

Before i doubted that ratings were bought. But now am sure of it. I was expecting alot of this movie , all i can say that the 1st 2 hours were really boring. Even the fighting part at the end was not as expected. What happened to hulk? Thor? Captin america some how carries thor's axe, howwww!. They just reuined this movie.

I can't even find the words to describe how dissappointed I am... All these years, all these movies, and all this build up of excitement - all for nothing.. I'll just watch "Infinity War" over and over again, until I forget they ruined it all like this..

Whilst the visual effects are the highlight, this film did not delight or live up to the fantastic setup from Infinity War.The pace is off, the characters are painfully not funny or behave in ways which have been set out in the previous 21 movies.I have enjoyed TV series finales more than this. It was a huge undertaking to get to this point and generally the previous films were good, this for missed the mark.In Infinity War when Spiderman met his demise - that was a touching moment, this film cannot recreate that at all, I found the emotional scenes more amusing than sad or emotive.I do not want to write spoilers for the movie so that is all I can say but this for me was the worst MCU movie to date.

The movie slowed right down and the old generic plot came into life because of the dialogue and acting. The movie turned heads and it became infinity war again but the feeling I had in infinity war was lost when the avengers came out going against the cgi mess which could be compared to gods vs humans. The movie had ups and downs but the highs were high and the downs didnt leave a bad taste in your mouth to make this a solid film

Infinity war was better than this garbage. 3hrs
Seriously

I love the Marvel Universe and even though not every Marvel movie was fantastic I really enjoyed all of them. After reading many good reviews I expected a lot from this finale. But it was the first Marvel movie where I left the cinema feeling like 'I don't know if I really enjoyed this movie'.It's just way, way too much crammed in one single movie. A huge number of characters, some just came flying in out of nowhere not giving the viewer time to remember which character it is they're seeing. Combined with an enormous amount of locations, an enormous amount of story lines which went all over the place time-wise as a result of time travel. It was just too much. I really struggled during the movie to keep up with things.
So after all this time, all these great Marvel movies I expected to be blown away. But I'm actually just really disappointed... For me this finale is Marvel unworthy. Shame.

Too slow. Too boring. Way too long. Too much drama. Seriously did we have to delve into everyone's past? And every team that went back for the stones encountered universe shattering difficulty. Wow so original. What was Marvel thinking? I had high hopes for this finale but it definitely did not deliver. The actors delivered respectable performances. Unfortunately they were hampered by a 2nd rate script. And where was the humor of Ant-Man and Ragnarok that endeared us all to these famous characters? Dullsville. It was almost shameful the way Hulk was marginalized. Yeah I know all the legal garbage behind him not getting a solo film. But here was a chance to show us what he can do and you failed, Marvel. Speaking of Marvel, she was about as inspiring as Ben Stein. I did not care for Larson's rendendtion of the character anyway so her minimal impact was Ok by me. Sorry but this movie was very underwhelming. Too bad.

I really tried to like it but it was a cheesy movie. They really downgraded vs infinity war which was unique and cool. This was 90% scenes of superhero's crying and moaning about how life is so hard and 10% was actual action. Like the battle scene was the only cool scene in the whole film along with one or 2 funny moments like with drunk fat Thor and stuff and the cast being good. Storyline was rushed and stolen from other greater movies. Seemed like they wanted to wrap things up and go home. This was a sleeper and 3 hours is way too long they could've easily cut out many of those crying scenes and made it a 1 hour thing. Very cliche and cheesy movie, not worth the hype at all. I feel like most people only voted highly because the name is "Avengers" not because of the content it presents.

If they gave me a couple of free tickets to watch this movie for a second time, I would prefer to throw the tickets in the trash than waste more time with this. The time-travel story is a mess, and the whole thing is too long and boring. Infinity war was so much better...

Endgame is a fun movie to go see, it has its problems but is a fun movie. These reviews on here giving it 10 out of 10 and saying that is the first perfect movie are 100% wrong. Dont go in expecting this movie to be better than godfather or citizen kane as these reviews describe. It's a fun movie with fun action, no it's not an oscar contender, no it's not a ground breaking never before been done movie, and no it is not a 10 out of 10 perfect movie. Go in expecting a fun watch with some cringy comedy and you will enjoy the experience. But dont listen to the people saying that this is a perfect movie, or the best ever made.
A movie which was not expected but a movie which was truly deserved.

This movie is 3 hours of fanservice, but it all comes from the best place possible: from the love of this franchise, it's characters and to reward the fans such as myself. So I can't rate it like I wasn't a fan. Sorry.Visually it's always the best you can imagine. The final fight is jaw-dropping, with some really "must use as wallpaper material" shots like Cap standing against Thanos and his army and such.
The cinematography is stunning and more stylish than ever. Like the blurred image of Thor leaving Thanos' farm house with that beautiful music at the end of the first chapter of the film.
The IMAX 3D really comlimented the visuals here and there, but it's not needed.
The music is most likely the best from all Avengers movies here, even if it's not memorable like it's always tend to be, it really helps the tone.
People tend to say this is not acting what these people do in the Avengers movies but try to talk with green screen or while your colleague has some weird bubbles on him/herself and make it believeable for the audience. Don't underestimate these movies people like Thanos did with the Avengers.
The characters are all at their best here, at least who are in the meat of the movie. And all the bring back characters has their very little, but effective moments. The tragic moments will shock you, the funny moments will make you laugh your ass off, and all the in-between moments will entertain you. A lot of encounters and re-connetions happen in this film and all of them varies to heartwarming to wholesome to touching. Tony's daughter's line that Tony gives her back at the end is wholesomely touching. There are no dull or unwanted scenes I could think of. Even if you disagree with some choices the directors made they still great ideas, and show a new side of the characters. There are so many callbacks to scenes or lines that will make you smile, warm your heart or even cry that I couldn't count. The story is more interesting than Infinity War and never sits down for a moment, but gives some breathing moments for you to buckle up for the next big one. The twists and turns are mostly unpredictable, even if you thought who will die, they die in a surprising way.And with the previous statement we came to the really spoilery part of the review:HUGE SPOILERS:
The 4 best parts of the movie were for me all about to give the best farewells to Cap and Tony.
1. Cap uses Mjölnir in maybe the best coreographed and most heavy fight with Thanos is just a scene were you can't do anything else just cheer and be happy to live in this age.
2. Tony dies with the most memorable fashion, saying "I am Iron Man" to Thanos after we've seen the most satisfying scene ever: Thanos tries to snap but nothing happens, becasue Tony has the gauntlet he made with all the stones. And Pepper telling Tony at his final moments that everyone is safe and he can rest now made me genuinely cry the first time sitting in a movie theater.
3. Tony's funeral on the river where his house stands, with all his friends watching and the audience reading the text stating that there's the proof Tony Stark had a heart with his iconic chest plate is made me cry even more.
4. Cap finally goes back to Peggy to compliance his promise and dance with her is the perfect ending scene to his arc, and to this Golden Age of Marvel Cinema.
SPOILERS END!The only negative is that you didn't had to watch Captain Marvel for this movie, but that's not the movie's fault, but the false advertisement's. She doesn't contributes much, really dull and uninteresting but at least has really few screen time. And she does her job, being powerful and not stealing the show from the older characters who deserve the spotlights. Her hair is ultra lame tho, even if it was a reference to her late mentor. I could've be picky and say some characters could live if they used the stones and qauntum realm, butt that would've just destroy their character arcs in an instant. It works in movies like Deadpool where there are no rules, but not here. And for some of the characters really needed to die, and fulfill their purpose in the grand story.I could just go on and on what I loved about this movie, but that would be just boring and you will watch this movie even if you don't read a random 22 year old guy's review on the internet. So there are my closing thoughts on the movie and the Avengers franchsie in general.The Avengers in 2012 showed us something new and never done before, Age of Ultron with it's problems was a likeable and entertaining movie that had some great groundwork for later movies, Infinity War made the impossible come true, and Endgame complimented the fans of the series the best way possible that everyone will remember as the next decades come. Thank you Russo Brothers, the Avengers cast, everyone worked on these movies (even the weaker ones) and especially for Stan Lee to made my childhood dream possible... f.u.c.k. I'm crying even while writing this review. So it's time to END it here. Thanks for reading.
3 hours of absolute drag, cheesy predictable ending and so many God damn plotholes the entire time travel bs wack as hell

(Caution minor spoilers) I have been a fan of every marvel movie to date but left the theatre feeling sadness ... and not because of emotion brought on by the film. This sadness was because of a variety of holes in the plot and our most powerful avengers (in the comics and previous movies) being reduced to a fat drunk god of thunder , and a not so Incredible but intelligent non-aggressive Hulk. And some how captain America gains the ability to shoot lightning? For this reason Thor (arguably the strongest avenger ever in the comics and also portrayed that way in the previous film Infinity War ) could have been completely removed from the end game because he is made out to be helpless and his abilities (which used to be those of a god) can now be possessed by humans. While all other marvel films remain true to the characters and there unrelenting will to save the universe, this film seems to take some of the strongest hero's in the MCU and reduce them to zeros. It left more questions then answers in an ending unfit for Marvels "biggest" film to date .

It did its job at providing a satisfying conclusion for the quadrilogy. I don't think that it does anything exceptional or bad. Actually, that's not true. It does one thing exceptionally: It's three hours but I never felt the runtime. And it does something bad: The fat suit for Thor looked soooo fake.And I personally thought what they did with the Hulk was hilarious.But I'm honestly sick of Marvel at this point. I'm sick of superheroes and supervillains and the whole interrupting the plot to make a joke thing. And I can only see myself watching this again if someone else wants to watch it. I'm glad The Boys is a thing!

That is the sign of a good movie. From start to finish your basically glued to it. And the humor in it is better than expected. The action and special effects are above avg. Good story line to follow the previous movie.

I am not going to spoil too much. I just got disappointed with the storyline..
I believe superhero origins were missing in this movie. Character was developed with the lowest priority. And the ending was specially disappointing..
I expected a power punch of the superheroes what I missed specially of Thor.
This movie just gave me an example of highest hype with lower result.

People won't agree with me because they are blinded by the hype and grandeur of the movie and the way it has been marketed. But this is one movie that has dozen of flaws, stupidity and unnecessary forced humour scenes.
1. How on earth did Tony figure out time-travel is possible and perfectly safe in just a night, without any failures. Just for the sake of argument, he had help from Ant-man(which isn't shown in the movie), but let's just assume it, why a mind like Tony, the smartest on earth didn't figure it out earlier, why the avengers didn't even discuss time travel earlier during those 5 years ?2. Captain Marvel has disappeared from the entire movie, honestly Rocket had x3 times more screen appearance than the strongest marvel character. The avengers don't even speak her name or call out for help when going back in time to collect the stones. The director didn't even talk about it so the people watching it completely forget about her. And then she suddenly appears in the end scene.3. The entire plot is very mediocre, quite stupid and hastily made.4. Why o why did you ruin Thor, what was the reason behind it ? Don't tell me that he was depressed and defeated so he became a like ginger. Because 5 years of beer drinking and getting fat and all it took was 5 minutes of absolutely no convincing to get back into the game. Highly stupid and unnecessary.6. So much of time and effort and some amazing scenes are put into Infinity war to get Thor his new axe. And now the hammer is suddenly just back. Because the present Thor goes back to past and just takes the hammer and returns back. So what does the past Thor uses now ? And why put so much effort to create an awesome axe when you again brought back hammer. Absolutely no sense.8. A very minute but noticeable point. Apparently normal humans(clint and natasha) can breathe on the other planets without any issues, they all have same atmosphere and gravity like earth. For someone who is a fan of space and galaxy genre, finds it really stupid.9. When you go back and take infinity stones , and disturb that past reality it creates problems, okay that's standard time travel issue, so the solution is to put back infinity stones and everything is good. That's fine.
But the hammer was taken from the past Thor and wasn't returned. But no body cares about that. Apparently magically a new hammer will appear on its own somehow. From such a large scale franchise, one of the ugliest time travel stuff.
I can go on and on and on about the bad points in the movie because it has no end.
The emotional content of the movie is pretty good, especially the scenes involving Tony, pepper and spiderman.
Yes there are mistakes in every movie. But one can't expect such stupid stuff from Endgame. The largest movie ever in past two decades after having a runtime of over 180 minutes.
HIGHLY DISAPPOINTING.
Infinity War was the end to me. This is just unacceptable.

Perhaps some fans expecting a colossal/great war between thanos against the remaining avengers. But what endgame provide is simply an unlogical storytelling. First, they really dont know how to put captain marvel in the story. Second, there should be 2 gamora after hulk use the stones. Third, is that really hard to beat thanos while in the beginning the rest of the avengers easily chop thanos' head. Fourth, captain marvel make it too difficult to hold thanos' fingers for flicking? All of those issues are not sensibly accepted. The plot is too shallow, and they try to force the story to be realistic which absolutely uninteresting and rubbish.

I thought the mcu was going to change after infinity war but this garbage proved me wrong. I thought they would stop doing the same generic garbage crap after infinity war but nope. Tbh it still hurts that's they reversed infinity war, infinity war would still be a 10/10 if they didn't reverse it and I'd be a marvel fan boy but nope, they just had to turn to this garbage again.

Didn't live up to the hype even a little bit, and DEFINITELY didn't need to be 3 hours long. Ignoring the fact that as a writer I think time travel is a lazy plot device, it made no sense. You can't have the Ancient One lay out that by taking the Stones they create alternate timelines, and then create 2 alternate timelines, one where Tony had a heart attack and Loki got loose (which I know was to give the Disney+ show footing, but there were other ways to do it. Like, say, reverse one of the weakest deaths in the MCU. Just a thought.), and where Steve went back to Peggy. Which, I might add, makes end of the movie make NO sense. If by changing the past creates alternate timeline, how did Steve get back into our timeline to give Sam the shield?I haven't talked about Thor yet because I need to keep my blood pressure level but I'll try to be quick. Thor had an excellent storyline coming out of Ragnarok and Infinity War, about grief and power and I was really excited to see what would happen with his storyline in Endgame. So imagine how disappointed I was to see this Noble, fantastic character get turned into a running fat joke. And moreover, to see how his storyline was shattered so that he could be made into a joke. Marvel had the beginnings of a great storyline about grief and recovery and men's mental health (which is WHOLLY over looked in media), and threw it away to do that. Coming from the way they handled Tony Stark and PTSD, I really expected more from Marvel (and that scene with Rocket slapping Thor out of a panic attack? Not cool Marvel, not cool at all.)I will say that the ONLY reason I didn't give this movie a worse rating is because of that final battle scene. Absolutely gorgeous and without a doubt one of my favorite Marvel moments, especially Cap wielding Mjolnir.In conclusion, I read this fan fiction back in 2012, I didn't like it then and I don't like its filmed version any better. Watch the battle scene and the scenes with Tony and his daughter and then call it a day. Don't waste 3 hours.
I enjoyed watching the previous ones.Now this one is too long, 3 Hrs.

Endgame's here! We waited for it and it came fast as well. Just a year. Enough to generate the kind of buzz, MARVEL wanted. Because in front of Infinity War, This stands nowhere. It's my personal opinion so just relax. At the run time of more than 3+ hr, we waited for 2 hour just to realize it's all actually happened which was already there in the fan theories. Yet a fan has a patience to grant his left patience towards a climax which should have been better or more powerful than Infinity War. Honestly I felt more bad seeing those superheroes turning to dust in Infinity War rather than seeing the main Avengers dying in Endgame. And the time travel. So easy for them to make it happen right. An easy plan which was well executed by our Avengers. And they did get the stones back, all of them. Without any complications! Well this didn't worked for me. We have seen Avengers thriving to fight Thanos in Infinity War. But here, well I would just say poor Thanos! At our climax, everybody's a superhero. Literally everybody. Like they were just waiting to show up in the end somewhere behind the Avengers office. Emotionally, that's good but cinematically that's weak! No fear we had like the 'what if' moment in Infinity War. And honestly Infinity War stays over the top than Endgame in terms of action, plot lines, music, vfx. So here's my rating. 6. And by the way it's a one time watch, to fulfill the curiosity of the hype!

A lot in Endgame was great but there were more than a few sub-par moments. There were numerous plotholes, including in relation to the major plot in the middle of the movie, they ruined several of the characters, and the final resolution was lame. And yes, there are about a dozen undeserved "woke" moments...

The 22nd film in Marvel Cinema Universe has an end of term feel about it. This shows with the lack of post credit scenes.With the population of the universe halved, Thanos has completed his task.The remainder of Earth superheroes try to retrieve the Infinity Gauntlet but Thanos destroyed it.It is the appearance of Ant Man who escapes from the Quantum Realm and shows up on Earth after five years that leads to a plan and it involves a Time Heist.What is left of the team go back to different time zones and different parts of the universe to collect the infinity gems. This means re-enacting scenes from previous Marvel films such as Captain America 2: The Winter Soldier. It leads to a moment where Robert Downey Jr, Tom Hiddleston, Chris Hemsworth all vie to be in the same shot with a particular superstar actor who supposedly called time on his acting career last year.It is a big spectacle, there is a major battle that comes across as flat when it needed to be better choreographed. There are some emotional scenes with some characters among the fallen.However this is one long movie. It needed to cut at least 45 minutes from its running time. The time travel elements might make sense in comics but not here. At one point, I thought the Russo Brothers were going to outdo Peter Jackson by dragging the film's ending on and on.

The only word I could muster after the screen cut to black was "Unbelievable."The Marvel Cinematic Universe is an achievement in film like we've never seen before, and Avengers: Endgame is the perfect culmination of this journey we have been on over the last decade. I genuinely cannot comprehend a more perfect way to end this story along with several character arcs.Endgame takes all of the best things from the previous 21 films and packs them seamlessly into the 3-hour runtime that still somehow leaves you wanting more.
All of the main characters give pinnacle performances here (one in particular, which you might have a guess but I will refrain from saying here).Hours later, I am still mostly speechless. Nothing else I can put into words will be able to do this film justice. You simply have to experience it for yourself.If you're a lifelong Marvel fan, you will swoon over this film. It will touch your heart. It will go down in history. Now stop what you're doing and go experience Avengers: Endgame.
This was a great movie but Thanos just battling everyone without the stones and somehow winning just annoyed me.

Well, just got back from watching this movie. I'm a long time fan of all the MCU movies since the very first Iron Man, seen each one of those 20+ movies 3 or more times each. I was in awe after watching Infinity War (IW) and I had the highest of expectations for the EndGame. The joy I felt watching Thor with his new blueish glowing axe and sparking eyes in IW was something imprinted in my mind. Yes, I really expected some glorified battle at least between Thor and IW did gave me the impression Thor is now the mighty superhero, the strongest at least to guide everyone else to whatever was planned to reverse the damage of Thanos in EndGame. Within the 15 first minutes instead of a mighty Thor, we get that laughable drunk guy??? WTF Marvel.Time travel? Ok... it may work or it may not in a movie. But honestly didn't feel like a suitable mechanism for the MCU universe. It felt like the "easy to get back mechanism" trick to restore whatever we have shown so far to the fans. I would rather prefer somehow an arcane ancient relic to be searched and found that would do the trick rather than this "seen so many times" approach of time travel. Honestly, didn't like the whole time-travel thing.The final battle... not even close to what we have seen in IW. Despite having every hero in there, it was very flat. Thanos was presented as just a bad guy, not that smart impressive genius and "correct" in his own mind". He didn't had the stones, still he looked like he is indestructible. How come this guy has such strength??????? I could say ok if he had the stones, without them, he still is an impossible-to-beat hero.Captain Marvel... well I hope MCU does not expect this character to be the new superhero to stand up and carry the whole thing to phase 4. One major issue is she is much more powerful than anyone else. I can't connect with that easily. Even Thor which I believe is the strongest among all superheroes had to go through a lot of pain and suffering all these years to reach at least his maximum potential (to watch him ruined by the authors in the most disgusting way... but let's put that aside). Captain Marvel? No, right at the start she can fly, needs no air, spits fireballs and can bring down a whole spaceship in seconds. So, why the heck she wasn't there in the front line to finish this battlse right away?? Utter crap.Finally, deaths of superheroes. Why why why why why? If you want to retire a character, there are dozen other ways to do that. I felt like these were forced deaths. Ok, I can understand some could die one way or another but all deaths seem to be rediculous; the whole point was just to eliminate them from the future MCU. Ok, just retire the characters in a memorable manner, no need to kill them. It felt like a part of my heart was ripped away in the worst manner; completely unjustified deaths. Other reviewers explained that much better than me and I completely agree with them.Overall, it was of course visually brilliant but lacked in what matters, the story and this makes it an average film really. Not completely disappointing but didn't feel it made justice to the whole MCU phase 3 or as a worthy IW sequel.

I'm going to break this film into 3 parts.
Part 1 - 10/10
Part 2 - 7/10
Part 3 - 4/10Part 1:
It starts off perfect - the scenes with Hawkeye, Nebula and Tony, and the twist with Thanos destroying the stones are all top notch.The perfection continues as we jump ahead 5 years. The emotional weight of the snap is still felt in our characters, and you really get a sense of the dread and despair.Then Tony discovers time travel in about 11 seconds.Part 2:
We get to the meat of the film, and some odd choices are made. The first are the drastic changes in two characters: Thor and Hulk. They are now pure comic relief. I am not a particularly big fan of either of them, and I thought Thor's transformation into The Big Lebowski was very funny at times; but boy do I feel bad if you're fans of these characters.The time travel scenes themselves are a mixed bag. Tony, Captain America and Ant Man stealing the Mind and Space stones is fantastic. Tony and Cap going back further in time, not so much. I know Tony has daddy issues - we dealt with this back in Iron Man 2 - and I know Cap likes the lady he knew for a few days back in the 40s. This is the bathroom break scene.Hulk retrieves the Time Stone by making up an absurd promise he can't possibly know he'll keep. The entire Thor and Rocket scene could've been cut without losing anything except Cap getting the hammer later in the film I guess.The Soul Stone scene with Black Widow's death didn't work for me. It's one thing if the person getting the stone has to sacrifice that which he loves. It's another if the thing you love makes the choice for you. It didn't work for me. Which is unfortunate because I like Black Widow and was disappointed to see her die.Nebula (who might be my favorite character in this film) sets up the return of Thanos. Really liked how this was handled, even if it is a bit far fetched and doesn't make a ton of sense how Thanos got to the future.Part 3:
Here's where the film gets sloppy and makes poor choices. Hulk snaps his fingers, Thanos arrives, and we get the cool action scene of our original 3 heroes vs Thanos. Cap becomes worthy and gets the hammer (and...can also summon lightening?), but still gets his ass kicked. All good stuff.And then...Sigh.The "epic" ending to this film is the equivalent of an 11 year old dumping 3 bins of Marvel action figures onto the floor and playing with them for what seems like 9 hours. I didn't mind what some people lament as "fan service" up until this point, because we were focused on a few characters we really care about, that have been with us for about a decade.So many characters do so many things that I stopped caring, when the previous fight between Captain America, Iron Man and Thor vs Thanos was so much better. Go back to that! But you know, instead they have to cram every single character into this scene - including Pepper Pots in an Iron Man suit. Captain "Cheat Codes" Marvel comes in and does her thing. Spiderman activates "instant kill." Dr. Strange stops a flood or something.My mind starts wandering and I think "what is the point of the Space Stone if every wizard can open portals between worlds?" And "where were half these people in the last movie?" And "is Pepper in the Iron Man suit just so the scene with all the women looks more full, especially since they killed off the main one I care about?" And "why isn't anyone saying 'Hulk, wtf do you mean we have to return these stones?!?!?!'"Tony's death is unfortunately so predictable and crammed into this mess that it doesn't register as strongly as it should. Intimate fight scenes, like in the end of Civil War or Black Panther, are always much better than massive battle scenes. At the least, you need to separate the two.What should've happened is Tony and Cap decide to take the Gauntlet as far away as possible from the battle. Thor and Hulk try to hold off Thanos. Hulk succeeds in holding off Thanos long enough for them to escape, redeeming himself from his last fight with Thanos. But Thanos manages to catch up with Tony and Cap. They fight him, but Thanos is clearly too powerful. Realizing they can't beat Thanos, Cap puts on the Gauntlet and sacrifices himself (yes - Cap should've died, not Tony). This way, even if there is a still massive CGI fest for the kids, at least there's this more intimate battle between our main characters. That's why Infinity Wars worked so well IMO. You had the big battle in Wakanda, and the more intimate fight with Thanos.The very end is pure schmaltz. I'm not sure what went on with Cap - if that's a contradiction to how time travel works, or for some reason he was beamed back outside the portal? Either way, didn't like it.If they put the Stones back in the other universes, aren't there still no stones in theirs, meaning their universe is threatened by all the dark forces or whatever? I think I would've just screwed over those other universes, but that's me.Wouldn't mind seeing a spinoff movie where Loki has the Space Stone.
No spoilers but it was hyped up too much, and a lot of things just felt off in this movie the jokes and circumstances. It's gonna be one of those films where you're gonna love or just feel eh

Something so complicated and impossible was discovered within a few minutes movie time. They should have spent more time on that.Thor was funny indeed but they really ruined the character, made him a monkey-like troll.A big ship was teleported and broke the entire building's ceiling , but nobody heard that? A a stand off movie this one would have been a average one time watch with usual super hero stuff. But actually to conclude a franchise of this magnum, this is definitely not the way to do it. Maybe it because the crew and the directors got too much on their plate to handle. Unlike the previous MCU movies this movie took on a near to impossible task of connecting the dots from all the 22 movies and then bring it to a conclusion, which unfortunately just didn't happen. I would say personally as a fan this was a great disappointment as none of my favorite characters got enough screen time which they deserve and also it was like a dump yard all those who went missing being dumped in one place and suddenly they do their thing and its all done. Come on man its Tony and the send off is totally not worth it. Thor, maybe in the beginning I find it funny but once the story progress it just didn't go with the kinda of personality as we know. Capt. Marvel don't even know why she is in the movie first place, it would've made no difference even without her. The solution to bring ppl back it just happened over night and it was not convincing at all, except it involved Tony. I always thought it was going to be almost impossible to improve on Infinity War... and I think I've been proved right.
This was always going to be a film all about how the good guys could return to winning ways after getting their proverbial @as kicked in infinity war.
Yes we probably wanted to see some of the aftermath of half the universe being wiped out....but it didn't need to play out for so long.
To be honest I dislike most films when time travel becomes involved...I just think it all becomes a bit "well nothing really matters as we'll just go back in time and change it".
I've watched infinity war 8 times already... but i just can't imagine ever sitting through this that many times.
My honest opinion is it's too long....some of the main characters are just either disappointing or none existent.
Another issue..if you have a character as powerful as Captain Marvel the rest of the squad become a bit redundant...unless you a again decide to send her to the other side of the universe.
Some people will kid themselves that this is the peak of the whole journey.....its not...it already happened in infinity war.

Disney is destroying MCU with this movie... story is not that good...very slow in the first 2 hours...and then 30mn if action very intense ending with the death of the main hero...wow...good job Disney.... Experts in how to kill what they were not the creator...same thing will happen with Star Wars...3 hours wasted.

But I can't really tell if that's a good thing or not.I appreciate that Marvel is trying something different with this movie, that they changed their working formular to create something new, but for me it sadly didn't work out.In comparison to Infinity War, Endgame is just.....nh. Disappointing.
If you've seen all the other MCU movies you might get a kick out of all the references and jokes based on those, that's the stuff I greatly enjoyed. Endgame didn't take itself and it's characters too seriously and at times this worked out really well. But regretfully, there are others parts where this change of plans destroyed the movie for me.
I don't know, turning Thor into an alcoholic, lazy dude who does nothing besides playing Fortnite (yes, Fortnite is in this movie) all day just isn't funny at all and ruins the hard work Taika Waititi has put into him. I also hate what they did to Hulk/Banner, I always thought Banner was an extremly likeable and interesting character, but in this movie I couldn't stand him.
Most of the other characters are just _fine_, Tony and Steve being the only ones who really stand out. Endgame gives either of those characters important decisions to make and their dynamic is absolutely entertaining.
Steve's ending though was just awful. Not only was it predictable ever since we knew time travel would be part of the plot, it wasn't satisfying at all. Steve leaving his two best friends behind, who he hadn't seen in f i v e years, just to hang with the girl he met for a few weeks eighty years ago AFTER he already made out with her niece is just unbearable. Awful. Why would you do that.I liked the ending they gave Tony, it was fitting for his character and regarding his importance for the whole MCU he deserved a big goodbye.
To be honest, I would've liked it more if they gave Steve the big, heroic death and let Tony live in retirement with his family but hey, whatever.So in conclusion, after first watching it I really expected more. This just wasn't the big ending I was promised, it was weird at times and overall fine at best. I don't think it was necessary to make it three hours long. The Russo Brothers directed all of my favourite MCU movies so far, but this one was a total miss.
Wouldn't recommend if you're not a fan.
This movie is only made for Marvel fans. Not like the other 21 Marvel movies. They were entertaining every moviegoer.But Endgame will entertain especially Marvel fans.

Nearly 1000 reviews two days after the release, so you just need the basic information without spoilers.It's in my opinion the worst marvel movie I've seen and I've seen all except for the captian marvel movie. I loved the previous avengers movie, which I rated 8 out of 10. I was looking forward to the movie and got disappointed big time.Endgame is slow. I mean really slow. The first 2,5 h you barley see a action scene. It's full of plot holes, which make the movie unbelieveable. I know its fiction but that doesn't mean you can cut all the logic and get away with it. The plot itself was very predictable but there was not much plot left when you take the jokes and the fanservice away. The antagonist was reduced to the absolute minimum. Infinity War build Thanos as the best and complex villain in the MCU, just to turn him into a one dimensional world destroyer. They alter their characters in parodic ways. Some may find it funny but not me. The humor is also a big factor. Infinity War had funny moments but this was a absolute gatling gun fire of unnecessary jokes and none of them hit. The jokes were overdone and they rode the dead horse many times which lead me to hide my face behind my hands for most of the time. Maybe it's just not my kind of humor.Sooooo...3h of my lifetime I can't get back. It felt wasted. I was bored, angry and torn between sleeping in the chair or just walking out the cinema.

Loki stole the space stone in 2012... Alternative time has been created here at their own universe in 2012. It does not have affect on the future avengers' universe, but for this one in 2012 yes....2) How could Rogers use the lighting? In Thor 3, Odin said to Thor, that the hammer is just to help you concentrate, you have the power. Rogers should not have used the lighting as it is not the hammer which gives the power.... Anyway, the moment was fantastic when Rogers became worthy after what happened in Cap America 3 :)3) How could Thanos came thru the hole with his ship? The key was Stark's machine on their hand to navigate in time finding the proper way to the proper time. Thanos did not have such navigator to find the proper way of time in the hole because the one that 2012 Nebula had, she used to came back with the other avengers to open the hole for Thanos.And those worries are logic related. And i did not tell anything about the "easy" solutions such as the rat who accidentally push the exact button which brought back Ant-man and nothing about the "easy" jokes which could not correctly balanced out the basic depressing feeling of the movie. The depressing feeling was very good, but the jokes are not "worthy" :)

Not going to go into any spoilers I just felt that overall the movie was average, it did a lot of things right and a lot of things wrong. The acting was decent, the action scenes were good if few and short and the pacing wasn't atrocious.But there were flaws, Brie Larson could have been replaced by a cardboard cut out, some of the twists made little sense and the big fight was rather unsatisfying and had a really cringy scene (you'll know it when you see it)Ultimately it's worth watching but the people rating this a 10 are overly hyped or wearing blinders because there were more than enough flaws evident throughout the movie.
