10 on 10! Must watch.
I laughed, was speechless and even cried.

The premise of the quantum realm and time travel in MCU is, when you change the past, you're not changing the future. You made alternate realities. Like how nebula is killing her past self yet she didn't die with her. And how Thanos came to the future and lost means there's a reality where he never got any Infinity stones, coz if it's the same reality, Guardians of Galaxy wouldn't even be assemble.Now, how could Rogers change his past yet he could still be in the "normal" reality?

This movie was really good. I remember my self screaming at the movies sooooo bad along with every other fan! I watched this movie 2 times at the cinema! It was something else! But still something was missing! I don't know what but I gotta say that infinity war was superior! At least for me!

Avenger's Endgame is the finale of almost 20 years of Marvel's cinematic universe. As such, I went in with high hopes and came out with rather mediocre mixed feelings. A lot of this movie rides on the audience being emotionally attached to the existing Marvel Cinematic Universe movies.
The story-line is rather simplistic to be honest, if you watched Avenger's Infinity War, the "solution" that they comes up with feels a little Deus Ex Machina.The writers clearly and obviously wrote off any explanations of what the characters *should* have done by saying that there is canonically only one way that the story could have happened (by Strange checking the future timelines); in what is clearly an example of lazy writing.The visuals are fine, the music is great, character development is lacking; none of the characters actually make any on-screen development. In fact, to save on screen time, both the Hulk and Thor make off-screen development which feels cheap and misplaced.
Instead, the writers spend most of their time dwelling on rather lack lustre fight scenes and bad jokes. It was clear that this movie could have been so much more, if only be examining the deleted scenes.If you are a hardcore fan of Marvel movies, this is obviously a 100% watch, you will get all of their Easter eggs and nods to previous movies. If you are watching this movie series casually, and you are not emotionally attached to any of the characters & you can disconnect yourself from the nostalgia, then you will see behind the golden mask that the Russo Brothers and co. have crafted for this movie, that there is a lacklustre mess with no direction.
They seem to have gone more family friendly and the comedy inserts they put in from here to there are just cringe worthy. More drama than action. No thanks

Crying, cuddling, over sensitive. Even Hulk himself was taking selfies like a princess. WTF !Besides, there was only 15 minutes of action in a 3 hours movie. I have never seen so overrated movie on the site before.Enjoy !

People are out of their minds giving this movie a 10. It's good action and has some amazing visuals, but the story is seriously lacking and slowly plays out.They straight up ruin Thor and Hulk. I'm not sure what the purpose of having their movies were. I was waiting for Thor to summon the godly magic he has and transform back into the stud he was, but nope. Just the Lebowski version with lighting bolts flying out of his eyes. I hear people talking about "oh he's got PTSD from all the things he's been through". Give me a break. A. It's a movie. B. He's a God. C. Just give me the comic book hero we came to watch. Not this fat corny burnout.The Hulk. They made him a straight weenie. He's the "professor hulk" nobody wanted. Well, maybe six people total in the world. Everyone else wanted to see hulk finally get back to form and smash!!!! Instead he lightly taps a car hood and meanders off. The Bulk should never meander anywhere.Then there's the story that actually mainly revolves around the two characters you care nothing about. Nebula and Hawkeye. Sure they a cool to some degree but again, nobody wants to watch them on screen for hours.The whole time travel travesty they pulled with the alternative times lines really stupified things. I love how people say they can explain it when the writers and directors can't agree. Just google some articles and watch some interviews about it. In the end the time travel nonsense they pulled in the story doesn't make sense.Why is it that four avengers can take on Thanos with the Gauntlet and almost win, but non Gauntlet Thanos can whoop them all?How does Hawkeye live from that blast ending up in the sewer unharmed? How does starks human made nano tech suit hold the stones? I highly doubt it's nearly as powerful as a Gauntlet formed by giant elves from a dying star.Good lord, I could go on and on. There's three hours of this stuff. But what's good is an epic end battle and travels back to some of your favorite scenes from the previous films. Cap wielding the hammer is
The best part.All in all it's entertaining, but in. I way should be the categorized as one of the best movies ever.

That part of the movie became an illusion without detail. Then, Iron Man dies. SMH

Literally the whole first hour of the movie doesn't matter. We just spend the first part of the movie sulking around. Like, I get it already. I spent the whole last year accepting what happened in IW. I don't need to do it for an hour of a 3 and half hour movie. The rest of the time the Russo's can't handle out of all the complex emotions in this movie (Thor's funny depression), sharp pain from loss of loved ones boiled down to vague sadness, let's give Cap a happy ending to the expense of his character and common sense. They couldn't be bothered to give anyone a complete story arc so they just tried killing off/shooing away characters they didn't know what to do with (hey where's captain marvel, Valkyrie, shuri). While conveniently changing other character's complete behavior to fit the story (here's looking at you, hawkeye and hulk). The Russo's couldn't decide what to do so they just replayed marvel biggest hits with the biggest BS time traveling Deus ex machina and pieced it together with the roughest edits I've seen since Arrested Development season five. Maybe keeping the script from every actor up until the last minute isn't the best idea. But hey, the movie made a lot of money. So why should the story matter?

I have never been the biggest MCU fan, but for the most part I have enjoyed all of the movies they have made. When I came into this movie I wasn't expecting anything that would blow my mind away and after watching the movie I feel like my prediction was correct.The biggest problem for me wasn't the time travel, or the plot holes that came from the time travel... My biggest problem with this movie was the out of place humor. I was expecting this movie to be a lot more serious and grounded, but instead we get Fortnite jokes and fat Thor. I am fine with jokes, but in a series movie like Endgame it just did not work with me. The first act of the movie was also very slow, but unlike most people I actually thought the first act was pretty entertaining. Another problem I had with the movie was when they were trying to find the Soul Stone. So Hawkeye and Black Widow both go to try and obtain the soul stone... Nebula knew that it takes a soul for a soul to obtain the stone, yet she doesn't say anything to the team. That is strong information not to share to Hawkeye and Black Widow, so that whole scene did not make any sense to me. Another problem with that scene was how they got the stone. To obtain the soul stone you have to sacrifice someone you love... they did not sacrifice each other, instead both of them were just trying to kill themselves.The movie had a lot of small errors, but it was still a very entertaining movie. The action in the movie was stunning along with the acting from Downey Jr. and Chris Evans. It's pretty obvious a lot of care and effort went into this movie, while also pleasing the fans. I would highly recommend going out and watching this movie.

I'm a HUGE Marvel fan and have been so excited for this movie, and to be honest, I'm disappointed. It was a decent movie, and I was invested in the story, but it was no where near my expectations.This movie was way too over hyped and in my opinion, messy. Humor was good, emotion was there (at the end), and concept was cool. But, ruined certain character arcs, was poorly executed, and was not worth the hype I gave it before seeing it.There were moments that made me very emotional, laugh, and made me jump with excitement which is all a plus. I came out of the theater crying a mix of happy and sad tears, but the more I think about it, there were so many flaws (mostly to do with character arcs). It was so fast paced with the characters and ruined the genuine connection we built with them in past movies. It's almost like they're completely different people. All in all, it was an ending we won't forget... even though it kind of flopped.

Bruce Banner takes it and puts it in his hand and try to make a flick but he falls down because of the power of the stones. On the other side, Nebula opens the Quantum gap to thanos and his army. Infinity war I loved. The pacing, the introduction of the many characters and the jaw dropping ending. I went back to see it three times.Endgame wholeheartedly disappointed. Why?**SPOILERS**Okay, let's get the plot holes/weak links out of the way:-1) The original glove had to be forged by a dying star. Somehow Stark created one on Earth...no explanation.
2) The slight of hand to steal the stones from Thanos...really?
3) How does Iron Man's gloves survive having all Infinity stones on it.
4) Tilda Swinton gave up the Time Stone far too easily.
5) I could be wrong but I didn't think the Tesseract could be handled by a human?
6) Several avengers could barely keep Thanos using the glove before. In fact, they failed. It seemed much easier this time round!
7) DId no one want to tip off Hawkeye and Black Widow as to how they had to unlock the Soul Stone?
8) All of a sudden Captain America seems to be able to use Thor's Hammer at will when it moved only a little before. What makes him more worthy now?
9) Captain Marvel WOEFULLY underused. Shows up to run through a few ships and land a few punches. What a waste.
10) Did Nick Fury, the instigator of the Avengers, not get an invite to the finale? Rude.These are off the top of my head as I write this. I am sure I could think of more.Fair play to Marvel for wanting to make this a more human story...I think. But sadly they failed to create a emotional finale and and succumbed to the inevitable fighting.I didn't get the 'feeling' of the 5 years they skipped over, Black Widow holding things together, Hawkeye going rogue. The quantum timeline plot line is weak in my opinion and slightly predictable.The loss of BW and Iron Man should have been major heart breaking sequences but I saw the BW scene coming a mile off and I was too bewildered as to how Stark got the stones to give a damn about his death scene.I wanted more of a surprise, more originality, this is a comic universe where they've spent years devising a story arch. Is this the best ending they could have come up with? One that ends in another fight, a slight of hand and a click of fingers? Nope sorry, I felt little jeapordy and zero tension compared to Infinity War where I ended up almost falling of my chair.I'm no writer but I've seen enough Sci Fi and read enough comics to know they could have done so much more. Why not split dimensions? Make half the team sacrifice themselves for others? Or something radicallike that. Not a timeline do-over with another big fight with only a couple of fatalities!I could rant for a long time. It's not a terrible film, The Last Jedi it isn't. It's just utterly average, hence my 5/10. With 3 Hours they could have done so much more and my expectations after the superb Infinity War were high. I am mortified to be as disappointed as I am.I want to return and give it another chance...but 3.5 hours in a movie theatre. I don't want to..which is the biggest tear jerking result of the movie.....

Okay after reading such amazing reviews for this film.I came to see this Film with anticipation that it will top all of the mcu movies,but for me honestly I think Infinity War is a better movie.But that doesn't mean it's bad,I think you just don't have to hype things and left dissapointed , but I was never dissapointed.This movie has a problem on pacing, it was slow and it looks boring, but hey! There must be a lot of brainless fan boys highly rating this movie ... compared to its predecessor (Infinity War) Endgame was a real let down.
I won't reveal spoilers. But I will say the pacing was very bad.... very very slow at the start to the point I was nodding off in the theatre .... the movie before had great pacing of action, drama and comedy...... Endgames first half was just boring.
Also balance of heroes in the first movie was done much better than this movie which really should have been called Captain America & Iron Man + Avengers.
And time travel as a plot device is a very lazy way of solving issues ... I cringed when that came up ........ Thanos and his lieutenants were a threat in Infinity War... in this movie they felt really dumbed down.

Avengers Endgame is the epic conclusion to infinity saga and the final chapter to a 22 movie franchise. We of course have to give credit to the Russo Brothers for directed not only this movie but also Avengers Infinity War (2018) , Captain America the Winter Soldier (2014) and Captain America Civil War (2016). After the snap by the Mad Titan Thanos who is perfectly played by Josh Brolin and the Avengers must restore the damage and defeat Thanos once and for all. This movie also wrapped up some character arcs like Captain America (Chris Evans) and Iron Man (Robert Downey Jr). But with all of these Pros there are Cons. One of them is how they handled the character Captain Marvel (Brie Larson) who has no personality no character arc or development. All we know about her is that she is overpowered and gives a little smirk when she give a clever remark. I get it they just introduced her but come on at least give her some more screen, she was in the first ten minutes and then doesn't show up until the last 20 minutes to beat the crap out of thanos and his army. Another issue is how they handled Thor (Chris Hemsworth). Like I understand that Thor is depressed and blames himself for the snap but seriously that doesn't mean he becomes an alcoholic, lazy,fat guy who plays Fortnite. It ruins how they portrayed Thor in Thor Ragnarok (2017) and in Infinity War (2018). One good good thing about Endgame is the fan service in the movie such as all the references to the other MCU movies such as the first Avengers (2012), Doctor Strange (2016), Guardians of the galaxy (2014), Thor the Dark World (2013), Avengers Infinity War (2018), Captain America the first Avengers (2011) and Captain America the Winter Soldier (2014). I also enjoyed how they gave the underdeveloped character such as Nebula, War Machine and Hawkeye, especially Nebula who develops a friendship with War Machine and we feel for her as she used to be a minor character but now played a important role and has the spotlight in some scenes. We now we finally get to best scene in not only this movie but also the entire MCU. The final battle with all the heroes vs Thanos army where everyone has their moment to shine like when Scarlet Witch fight Thanos and breaks his sword, when spiderman activate instant kill, when Iron man and Pepper Fight together and of course when Captain America finally wields Mjolnir and absolutely beats thanos down and all of this leads to the saddest scene in all of the MCU, Iron Man's death scene which made even the toughest of men cry. This movie is will go down as the best movie of the decade and any more years to come.

The movie was ok. Not good. Not bad. Just ok. All the fanboys out there giving this an average rating of 9.1 haven't seen a 9/10 movie ever or simply vote this up this high because they haven't been cuddled enough as a kid or something.The story was what bugged me the most. It wasn't exciting at all. Never once did I think ok this is a bad moment to go to the toilet or something. It really was that dull.This is like the new star wars movies. Made for children who don't care about the plot and just want to see action and by now boring jokes.

The movie was great, there's no doubt about it, but that was it. I remember after infinity war, people in the cinema were speechless, crying, sobbing, hugging each other - there was nothing like that here. I wish there were more surprises. Watching this movie I imagine screenwriters struggling to write decent scenes while the producers demand a grand, comic-book-style finale to satisfy every fan of every Avenger character. The result apparently succeeds in thrilling long-term Marvel Universe fans. For the rest of us this is a bewildering and mostly tedious mix of melodrama and overwrought FX actionI have watched, and often enjoyed, the previous films from the Marvel Cinematic franchise. So I'm familiar with the backstory of the characters. And I know to come to these movies prepared not only to suspend critical thinking but also to let my eyes glaze over during the prolonged action scenes. To the extent I was able to do this for 3 hours I was rewarded with enough situation comedy to keep me in my seat.But the melodramatic angst of the characters in the context of the plot is just irritating. Are you pining over the fact that your buddy might not survive the effort to resurrect the half of the living universe wiped out in Infinity War? Do you and every Avenger suffer from Borderline Personality Disorder?The only protagonists that hold my sympathy and respect for "keeping it real" are Tony Stark and Thor. (I'm not sure who merits more credit for that: their actors or their writers.) Otherwise I actually found myself rooting for Thanos: Though we may disagree with his objectives, at least he thinks big and doesn't indulge in ennui. He hews to his principles and does not hesitate to sacrifice himself for them. He is the only true hero in this movie, which makes it a tragedy.

Avengers endgame one of the most anticipated movies of 2019 was watchable. The story was way too predictable except the ending. Movie contains some of the best VFX graphics well it's Marvel. The performances of the actors is also very brilliant. MCU fans won't want to miss it.

I think personally, it is wat to shoved. Time travel? Really? it is not really a solution tbh, and oh, there are also too many plot holes. The pacing is also way too damn slow, and it can get boring, at least for me. The action is great, but it is mostly time travel stuff. It ain't linear, so it may confuse some of you, especially myself. I just like infinity war better. Straight to the point, full of action and emotions. One of the things that i like about this movie is the ending with captain America getting old, enjoying his life. Really nice touch ngl. but this movie is an epic conclusion nonetheless. I would personally recommend to any hero fans, but may not for some who does not want stuff like i just pointed out.

My initial reaction coming out of the theatre was of great satisfaction and little sadness (black widow and iron man deaths). But as I gave more thought to the movie, I felt it could have been taken in a very different direction.The time travel plan was good and I enjoyed the time travel scenes, but left me with a glaring question.....Wouldn't retrieving the stones from the past completely erase the Infinity War timeline as Thanos wouldn't be able to find the stones in the past??.....which means there was no snap and everybody just survived?? Also wouldn't it erase the present timeline of this movie and give rise to an entirely new timeline??In my opinion, 5 years was too much of a gap, instead 1 year at the most would be more appropriate. Two reasons for this: 1. People move on with life in 5 years. 2. 5 years is too much of a time to avenge for the Earths Mightiest Heroes.My other gripe is when Iron man wears his gauntlet with the infinity stones, how can he survive that?? A normal human cannot even survive holding just the power stone by itself. In my opinion it should have been either Captain Marvel or Thor or may be even Captain America (as he's a superhuman) weikding Tony's gauntlet with the infity stones.Overall the movie ends up as a fun movie with great fan service as it touches upon the past movies and characters in a great culmination of 22 movies. I would even watch it multiple times but secretly would wish it was remade with Iron man surviving the end.

First hour of the movie was slow, it could be shortened but I like first hour because it showed us heroes struggles and their human side for example, Cap was in a therapy group and iron man's relationship with his daughter. when the movie approaches the end it dragges you so 3 hours long doesn't bother you. on the other hand, I can't say that Endgame is better than Infinity war or vice versa. Both movies have their own moments I think Endgame's emotional tone was better but Infinity war's humor and battle scenes were better. I feel disappointed final battle of Endgame it was concluded too quickly Russo brothers' battle scenes in Civil war and Infinity war were better than Endgame. I was very angry with absence of Hulk Infinity war but I liked him in in this movie and I also liked Thor and Rocket too. Lastly, I am pleased Iron man and Cap's endings and also widow's their fates in the movie was very emotional. Although, its ridiculous time-travel plot it has its own moments completes 22 films's integrated saga. I give 7 point out of 10.

To describe it in one word - BORING. No real emotional pull from the vanishing in infinity war and any attempt to, was handled poorly. The opening Hawkeye scene a perfect example The first 45 minutes really plods.The main plot, when we finally get to it, might leave you cringing as will the character assassination of Thor and Hulk - silliness taken a step too far.
Some huge inconsistencies in the story too that really irked me, like one throw of the Storm-breaker piercing Thanos despite wearing the gauntlet in infinity, to being powerless to stop him when he is without the gauntlet?!!! And the ending, why didn't they use the time stone to stop the invasion and ensure no avengers die?!!! And how come Hawkeye could handle an infinity stone when it nearly shredded all the guardians in vol 1?!! The end fight scene was boring and poorly choreographed. Overall, I think the russo's ran out of ideas and were overwhelmed with the task of bringing the various storylines and characters together. A shame it ended so shambolically, I had hoped and expected so much more.

Avengers: Endgame is the final film to the Infinity saga in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. The story is emotional, unpredictable, unforgettable, complex and intense. The story does continue on right after infinity war had finsihed, and I thought it was a good way too start because the characters can give you an understanding of how they are feeling. How much loss they have witnessed.
During the three hour film, you care so much for the characters that it makes you want them to live through the whole time, leaving with no casualties. The acting by the cast is outstanding, none of their lines sounded cheesy. Chris Evans and Robert Downey Jr especially. The audience has never seen the two characters shine so bright and powerful over the last 11 years. The visuals are the most impressive, it is shown to be Oscar worthy and you would be hungry for more as the film continues on. The final battle was the bomb, the mother of all battles, better then Ready Player One's finale. It's so big and all of it fits in perfectly. Avengers Endgame is the perfect finale that has been set up over the last 11 years. Its a rewatchable film and you will never see the characters the same way as you have seen them from the past films.

Endgame is filled with emotions, great scenes, beautiful cinematograhpy, and above all else; fantastic entertainment! This is what u would expect from a great superhero movie - so many great moments and wonderful send-offs to some characters.
Still I was not sold. I have a few nit-picks, but will ignore those for the big objections that brings the score down. But first the positives.This is the best most crowd pleasing Avengers movie yet, and as already mention; this movie is so beautiful to watch. The action fantastic! All the characters are great, but Iron Man, Black widow and cap america have absolutely stunning performances. Almost everything about this movie is top, top, top!Still, I will only give it a 2/10, which is actually generous. Let me tell you why.First, Thanos. Almost a full movie dedicated to this villain now and we know almost nothing about him. He wants to kill half the universe because... ???What drives him? Why collecting his "children"? He is dangerous, strong, and the biggest foe, but who is he? I was hoping some would be explained, but no. They instead make him more comical evil in this movie, why?Time travel sucks. No matter how good explanations are or what u do with it, time travel creates paradoxes, lingering questions, plot holes, and in this movie it creates evil Steve..Speaking of; Captain America is evil! Yes, in this movie he rips poor peggy from her husband and children so Cap can get laid. Horrible ending of the movie!Fat lazy Thor, and another dumb usage of Hulk, Loki! And that stupid girl power pose... oh God that was so cringe. I loved Cap Marvel movie, but here she is a deus ex machina - how did she fly that ship millions of light years without Tony dying? 2sec? Really?The more I think of the movie the lower my score becomes. I started with 7/10 just after seeing it, now I have it at 5/10 and Im not seeing it again. Way too many plot holes and major flaws.Edit: Saw it online today, and it is really badly put together movie. Got even more disappointed, so I will lower the score again to 4/10. I cannot go lower though since I have Wonder Woman on the same score, and Endgame is not worse than WW so I will keep it there. So, so disappointed... how could the Russo´s make such a bad movie? What happen?Edit2: After re-watching the fantastic Captain Marvel, which is one of if not the best superhero movie ever made, I decided to watch this trash again and I now believe Endgame to be one of the worst superhero movies ever made. It is not JL or BvS bad, but not far from it. Lowered the score to 2/10.
This movie suck, and anyone claiming this is a good movie is a moron.

This story-arc wrap-up starts with half the Avengers and world in general dead and no way to fix it. Only of course they figure out a way, because that was telegraphed in the last movie, and some of that goes right and some horribly wrong leading to, yet again, a massive battle.The movie is generally speaking as entertaining as the last one, although it's attempt to use it's time-travel conceit to include every single character from every cinematic marvel universe movie ever made can be wearying, with characters I don't quite remember, characters appearing too briefly to make an impact, and a tremendous number of non-speaking cameos that serve no purpose except to let the audience say, "oh yeah, them."The first half is pretty zippy, with lots of banter and some flat-out slapstick. But the movie also wants to delve into the self-sacrifice theme, so the movie drifts into increasing levels of sorrow.The movie ends, obviously, with a vast battle, and while it's quite good, with some serious "wow" moments, it is the smaller, character-driven moments that truly stand out, like two superheroes battling each other to be the one to self-sacrifice. And while the post-battle weep-fest seems a bit long, the film does end with a particularly satisfying resolution to one superhero's arc.Endgame gives you the solid, expected Avengers experience. Comedic, dramatic, special-effects driven, and overlong. It's well worth seeing even though ultimately it's nothing you haven't seen before.

Avengers End GameSo after twelve months of fan theories and speculation we finally get to see what happens to our surviving heroes after the events of Infinity war.
End game isn't just a conclusion to that movie but to all the movies from the Marvel cinematic universe.
This is a tall order for Directors the Russo brothers but boy have they nailed it!
End game is a sombre affair as you'd expect after half of all living creatures have been wiped out of the universe.
Essentially a movie that is spit into three defining acts.
The first showing the aftermath of Thanos's actions.
The second act is devoted to the surviving Avengers desperately trying to fight back (delivering fan service by the bucket load) before a satisfying conclusion that will have everyone on the edge of their seat.
End game may not ultimately thrill in the same way as Infinity War did but this final chapter is riveting from a storytelling point of view. It's a much deeper movie than its predecessor.
Only when revisiting Infinity War after End Game do you fully appreciate the amount of creativity that's gone into making both movies.
How the Russo brothers have managed to weave every story and character arc together is commendable.
Trying to decide which movie is best is difficult because I see them as one big five hour masterpiece rather than two separate movies.
I'm trying to remain vague here as I don't want to spoil anything for those who haven't yet seen the film.
Just as an insurance policy I've declared that this review may contain spoilers.
What I can divulge is that End Game is three hours of your life that you will be fully immersed and ultimately enjoy.
The lengthy runtime will fly by unnoticed.
Despite the sombre tone there's humour in this film.
The script writers employed by the MCU
are experts in creating witty dialogue and even though this film is serious it boasts more belly laughs than some intentional comedies.
The humour doesn't detract from what's at stake, rather it allows the audience a break from the building tension. Stakes are indeed high and all through the film there's a nagging doubt that The Avengers may actually fail.
It's refreshing that both this movie and its predecessor make believe that the bad guys can win.
Just like in real life there's not always a happy ending.
But after the events of Infinity War the good guys and the audience need that payoff.
Will it come? Well that's something you will have to find out for yourselves.
It's no spoiler to say there will be sacrifices along the way and the MCU will take a different path in the future.
End game is indeed an epic conclusion to all the hours of movies you have invested in up to this point.
It is of course a splendid technical achievement in terms of film making.
The nostalgic second act proves this.
Like its predecessor Infinity War, End Game will get even better with multiple revisits.
Definitely a film that I'm excited to see again.

The beginning............is absolute genius. The opening scene draws you in emotionally and gives you the true hatred for Thanos that you need in order to watch this movie. The rest of the movie erases that. If you think about this plot critically, there is no reason for the ending to be the way that it is.For the average fan, this movie is incredible. Not only does every character get their shining moment, but every moment you want as a casual fan, a CASUAL fan, happens for the first 2hr 40mins. The last 21 minutes however are lackluster. There is a LOT of fan-servicing.This movie however, is filled with plot holes that any critically thinking fan can see and loathe about. Not only are key mechanics not explained with any clarity, but they completely defy literally any concept of them that the human race of today have theorized about. The Russos simply write what they want into the storyline to make things work in their favor and that is that.SPOILER-SPOILER:
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
Tony's funeral is completely glazed over. I almost teared up when Pepper said her goodbye. But how do you not show a ceremony for his body? A STATUE maybe? This is THE foundation of the MCU thus far, cinematically, and you give CAP the glory of standing up to Thanos' armies by himself in the end? The Russo brothers blindly idolize Cap as an invulnerable super-human who can take any blow and get back up. Give me a reason for this.Captain Marvel is a badass for 3 minutes of the movie, and back-handed the next.Not to mention the Thanos that they fight in the end is not the Thanos that we've grown to hate. The Thanos we've grown to hate has killed trillions. He dies. The Thanos we get has not *snapped* yet, but the Russo brothers need a severed head to serve to fanboys.Why return the stones afterwards? Not only are you releasing the stones into other timelines and allowing for those timelines to create the Thanos we hated in Infinity War, but you're allowing your own timeline to be affected like the one's you manipulated the stones from. Not to mention the fact that Loki taking the stone and escaping in 2013 while having Cap and Tony go back in time WITHIN that separate timeline messed up further timelines. Are we to believe that the Avenger's are justified in ruining other timelines in order to fix their own?Why can't Thor speak to his mother about future events if she already knows that Thor in Endgame is in fact from the future. She know of future events but doesn't know about her incoming death? The movie's own logic explained that conversing with people in other timelines could ruin that timeline, yet not affect your timeline's future. With that said, why not just have Thor inform his mother of her death? This would not affect his timeline but allow Thor in the other timeline to have a mother. UGHThis movie is good for casual fans. This movie is a sub-5 rating for critical-thinking individuals. I only give this a 6 for the Russo brothers successfully drawing my attention away from fat Thor in the end and instilling that heroes with unideal bodies can be super too.

Am I the only one to think that the movie is bad and IW is far better? Personally, I expected Thanos to be defeated in the bloodiest way possible, which appeared to not be the case. Seeing how endgame goes pretty much wasted Thanos's character and strength. We didn't get to see Thanos kill anyone or fight the Avengers with his full strength. I mean, he's the villain Marvel's been working on so much so it'd be a waste just to see him perform like he did in the movie.Also, the way they messed with the timeline didn't seem to make a lot sense to me. They took every infinity stone from the past to the future in a strange way where they actually fought and had conversations with some of their past lives. Tbh, that leads to a confusion and a lot of questions regarding how the timeline will go on as a result of the additional moments that took place.Overall, I don't really like this movie. It's too predictable. I feel like it should've been a lot darker and bloodier, especially in the final battle. I was hoping for Thanos to kill multiple characters(even though he killed half of everyone in IW), something that will trigger massive rage in the Avengers and tense feelings within the audience during the battle scenes. I've been a big fan of the MCU and I expected this movie to be much more epic. Just like any other movies made by the Russo brothers, it's not bad but it could've been way better.

After Infinity war I had very high expectations, and boy I was wrong.Don't get me wrong, the movie is 'watchable' but far on quality and energy from the previous one.P.S - if you are hulk fan (like me!) get ready to be disappointed even more. Do yourself a favor and don't watch this movie.

Three words to describe the methodology inherent in destroying a franchise - or any story for that matter. For all the intrigue, conjecture, speculation, and cosmic potential Endgame enjoyed long before its release - and might have included - they opted for the least fascinating and pedestrian of stories: when it all else fails, just go back in time and change it! I do not mind heavy CGI movies with no substance; they're entertaining from a technical perspective, and when a decent story props it up, at least there exists some satisfaction. That said, with Infinity War, there was great possibility. I'm not going to bother with a detailed review here ... this movie was wrong ... all those richly detailed characters, all those amazing back stories, all that simmering creativity, all that ingenuity and inspiration totally and utterly wasted. I gave it 4 Stars just because it's nice to end the misery, but it is difficult to appreciation the wastefulness. Sad really.

No spoilers.The movie had a nice closing of the past 10 years but is far from the best Marvel movie which I had hoped for.Infinity war is head and shoulders above it due to its high pace and perfect character combinations. Endgame is funny, emotional and provides more depth to main character heroes. However, leaves so many important things out of focus despite its 3 hour runtime. Also, surprisngly feels like the Russos missed many great opportunities to make the movie better.Go and see it! Still important piece if the puzzle.

Just watched the movie. Despite my best wishes, I simply cannot find myself singing praises to such a poorly-done movie. Ranging from the grossly obvious CGI to the poorly written-out story line, Endgame is extremely underwhelming. Throughout the movie I found myself sitting in utter disbelief as to how Endgame went so wrong after a fantastic Infinity War.
It made a lot of money and that's this concludes my review

It's so well put together and emotional that anything that the film does badly is simply superfluous. The acting is spot on, the humor is good but not over the top. It wraps everything up so nicely, and the emotional moments make you feel. Iron Man dying had me in tears with his "proof that tony stark had a heart" floating across his lake. Captain America choosing to go back to his love in the 40s was gut wrenching. Everything was tied up, and it does feel like the end of an era in cinema. There will still be Marvel superhero movies. There still be heroes to look to. But new names will be taking up the mantle. It won't be the same, but not necessarily in a bad way. It will be just different. The end of the movie really hits you with how much these characters have changed in the last 10 year and 23 movies, and how things are different now. At first I thought the time travel narrative would be incredibly hokey, but it was so well done you can't help but give it credit. It's the most interesting use of time travel in a movie in a long time. Everything has been wrapped up. The only loose end is Loki and where be went while they were back in time. I guess time will tell.

Its sad to see it come to an end. But im satisfied by how it ended and how the story went through.
With the usual expected sense of humor in marvels movies and a good story line.

It doesn't feel long Every scene is very well thought but I expected a more serious and darker tone after what happened in ending of the previous movie. 1/3 of the movie is spent on giving new layers to characters, but after Ant-Man appears it becomes a silly movie targeted to teens. The solemn tone of the movie disappears without a proper transition. After that everything is messy and convoluted. It's not bad and they had a lot to include but they could avoid the journey through the past movies and use the time on depeloping and giving a proper conlcution to a 10 year saga.

Though the movie is decent, it in no way compares to Infinity War which was at least twice as good. This movie had two hours of boredom followed by a great third act. Wish they could of done this for the entire 3 hours vs just the last hour.

(feeling bad about it).Avengers: Endgame was my first movie I watched in Cinema with my buddy with an extraordinary hyped built after the events of Infinity War, but trust me it lacks the potential like Infinity war built already and also the reviews ( 8.9 ratings seriously) and how much this made money so far is just beyond me. gotta say here, INIFITY WAR was much better. stop trending the hype of Endgame its not that special.because some of the reasons why:1. Hawkeye received way too much screentime, that was just WHAT & Why ?

The flow of the movie was very slow and uneven, 2 whole hours introduction for 30min of action and suspnce.. when the action finaly came i couldnt even be excited.They tried to create emotions, but you can't force that ,when yoou devote your 2 first hours to nothing. It has soem great scenes and it wasn't so awful but i excpected much more from the closing movie of avengers with not so many plot holes...

It was a great conclusion to the Infinity saga but it lacked effectiveness for neutrals like myself. Only true fans will reap the full benefits of Avengers Endgame especially if they decide to look past the senselessness and predictability of the movie.Memorable moments are guranteed, however for neutrals this will be one of Marvel's most dissapointing films. It doesn't live up to the hype and it's way too predictable. Too many jokes, just the right amount of drama but not enough action.The best moments are the ones that make this movie slightly worth watching. If I had a blu ray of this movie I would skip to the most important moments because most of the film is pretty predictable and not very entertaining.Overall it was a good movie, but not one worth watching again.Spoiler : There is no post credit scene.

Honestly: at the 2 hour mark i was checking my watch to try and figure out how much more I had to put up with before it made sense.
The storyline was sporadic, and bounced around so much that it just got confusing and boring.

In my opinion this was a huge dissappointment for me. The movie lacks of action and full of irrational content. Its very slow and boring. First half was unnecessary and second half is below par. Im so sad that nearly nothing significant happened in whole 180 minutes. I was expecting the same vibe as infinity war or dark knight but this was more like age of ultron.

Believe it or not, I expected this storyline. That Thanos would destroy the stones and Avengers will move on until they find a way to travel back in time. I said I hope it wasn't using Quantum realm because it would be repeatable. And that's exactly what happened.The movie is plagued by plot holes. I will not go over all of them but I spent over an hour after the movie listing all the plot holes to my daughter. The biggest and the most ridiculous one is that the Avengers had only enough Pym particles for one round trip each. Movie made a big deal about this. But towards the end, Thanos uses one vial of Pym particle on his ship with everyone on board. With thousands of minion creatures on it. With no special "Quantum" suit or equipment. You mean to tell me Avengers could've just got on a vehicle and teleport all together with one vial? And with Hank Pym back now, they can time travel at will from now on. Or go back in time to get more just like they did in the movie. This completely ruins the Marvel Universe.Avengers can travel back in time where they first made the Ironman version of Infinity Gauntlet. Borrow it, defeat any villain with a snap, and return it to exact moment. Avengers of the past will understand since they did same thing when retrieving the stones.Also now everyone is Antman. Everyone can shrink, go to Quantum realm, and time travel. Nothing special about Antman now. These are just fraction of all the plot holes.There also was a huge plot hole fail in The Last Jedi when Holdo sliced Snoke's mothership by going lightspeed. Which ruined the Star Wars Universe. And these rivals that plot hole.Their version of time travel is a big mess too. It says past and future is not connected and changing past doesn't effect future but there are parts where it shows the new past effecting the future. And they were making fun of Back to the Future.

Seriously, this is probably one of the most overhyped movies that I have ever seen in my life, and a part of me wonders whether the MCU can actually survive after this film. Well, from looking at the reviews it seems like it satisfied quite a lot of people, but was it a good movie - well, no, not really. Okay, I enjoyed it, sort of, by the overhyped nature of this film sort of made it somewhat painful to sit through in places, and the three hour length, honestly, it could have simply been cut down somewhat.Look, don't get me wrong, I don't necessarily believe that this is a bad movie, but rather I felt that it was overtly long, overtly hyped, and in parts somewhat dull. As for the acting, well, it was passable, but not great. In fact I felt that Mark Ruffalo really didn't shine anywhere near as much as he did in the previous films.
Yet, the one thing that I'll give it credit for is the depth of the characters, and the fact that Captain Marvel did not dominate the film anywhere near as much as I, and many others, were expecting. The thing is that she popped in at the beginning, and at the end, and that was about it. The main focus of the film was on the three main Avengers from the original series.Yeah, okay, we also had Rocket Racoon playing a major role, and I'll certainly be giving it points for that - I love Rocket Racoon, and I suspect this is why he was brought into this film. In fact, by whittling down a lot of the characters did give it a bit more entertainment value, in that we weren't constantly jumping all over the place, as well as our attention being drawn apart by so many people. Instead we had what could be considered a core number and that was it.Mind you, they completely stuffed up the whole time line thing. You known, with the end part where they appeared to destroy Thanos and his cohorts. Then again, I also suspect that since they had time travelled to get here, they were probably just sent back to their original time line, namely so that we wouldn't end up having a complete Back to the Future style mess.Actually, that is something that I should mention, and that is the Back to the Future references. Yeah, we had a sort of jumping around to other parts of the series and reliving some of the older films. This, in part, made it feel like just one of those clip shows that some series tend to show because they are stuck for a story line. Then again, the clip show elements were rather small, and they ended up creating some interesting side shows, but it still felt like a clip.Oh, and then there was that part right at the beginning - it just happened too fast. After everything they had been through in the previous film, they pretty quickly found Thanos, and lopped his head of. Honestly, where was the master villian that we had seen in the previous film, the one that just seemed to be impossible to beat. Then again, I guess, without the infinity gauntlet, and his thugs, there probably isn't all that much to consider.

For what it is, it is fine. Enough pew pew pew, smashy smashy and flashy effects and explosions to mindlessly entertain the inner 8 year old.THAT is all that this is. Anybody who thinks this type of media deserves the highest marks is a cultural empty vessel. Anybody who thinks this colourful nonsense should be rated like actual movies with actual content is deluded.Mindless escapism is fine. it just isn't art.
This is the greatest movie I' ever watched!! Amazing work!!🔥🔥👌🏻🎞🙏🏻

Infinity wars was just epic. The build up from that film is what created so much hype towards endgame. However did endgame really deliver? I dint feel so.Gimmicky Time travel was also messed up, they tried so hard to make the audience buy it, when antman cracked a joke about it not being time travel. when tony stark said he wouldn't do it the first time. this to make the audience root for the plot. The time stone was gone when Thanos destroyed it, even borrowing stones from an alternate dimension would have been a great plot. And with all the intelligence in the marvel universe, humans crack time travel.. really..It was also like the guys were forced into being depressed. We had the heroes of the known universe until that point reporting to black widow? for what joy? and hawkeye, his only action sequences was running, and more running almost every time, but he has to run, your dealing with superheroes and super villains. the point I'm making here is that apart from not so great casting of certain characters, interaction and measurement of power has to be well translated. Anther example is Captain marvel making a guest appearance at the end, being able to over power Thanos while he wields the gauntlet.. Or tony stark taking a punch from Thanos without his headgear. His brains should have splattered. RDJ has a great personality, but the whole saga doesn't have to be about him, your dealing with the Marvel universe.Then you had them going back into separate timelines cooking up their own mini story sequences there, setting the energy of the movie offtrack.I dont know if I am watching the same movie as these guys with 10 stars, or is it just blind loyalty.For me avengers ended with infinity wars, so well done, character build up of Thanos was magnificent, to see him then reduced to a puppet with only sweet philosophy but not such a great death. Would be interested to hear about alternate plots and endings for endgame.
The culmination of the infinity saga,this movie is going down in history as one of its kind. MIND-BLOWING MASTERPIECE.Words can't describe the grandiosity of this film. Worth watching more than once.

From a comic fans perspective this may be a good movie, at least the last hour,
but for an admirer of cinema it is a great disappointment. The first two hours are expendable. The Russos try to be schmaltzy like Spielberg and funny like Waititi without having either of their chops and so they fail badly. They may do certain visual things really good but overall it seems to be a too big to succeed idea, to try and tie up every single storyline. I may also add that a lot of really stupid stuff happens that takes you out of the movie. Bad timing of mediocre jokes and some ridiculous mistakes. The pay off for the soapy stuff comes way too late. This is a not a great movie, unfortunately.

I went in to Avengers: Endgame with high expectations and they were still shattered.First off, nobody is ready for the 3 hours that conclude the Infinity Saga and if you think you are then you're wrong. This is easily the best MCU movie so far and one of the best superhero movies of all time. The visuals are stunning and the cast and crew goes all out to give us the cinematic event of a lifetime.The movie features a strong and engaging plot with directors Anthony and Joe Russo clearly showing us that they know what they're doing. Character arcs across the board come to a satisfying conclusion and just remind us why we, as fans, have invested this much in these films the past 11 years.Bring your tissues, because this is without a doubt the most emotional adventure that Marvel has put us on as an audience. Emotional scenes are backed up by Alan Silvestri's stunningly beautiful and goosebump-inducing soundtrack, with many callbacks to previous MCU movies that prove that this is a worthy conclusion.Incredibly astounding and emotionally affecting end to a saga that started with a billionaire in a cave with a box of scraps and a scrawny kid from Brooklyn who just wanted to do the right thing.Go see this film; you will not regret it at all.

They try to be different but it just doesnt do it for me. I already dislike Infinity war and the first half of this movie confirm my view. The first act of this movie should have been included in the infinity war. And that would make infinity war the perfect movie... Why? Just why are they doing it like this? Cut some unnecessary scene in the infinity war to get that 3 hour screen time and then end the film with Thanos head. We will face the shock of reality that even when they defeat the villain, its not enough. The world already changed. And then start the sequel, 5 year after, with that time travel plot. And rework the movie with a better story, or if you can, just give a brief explaination about the time travel plot so that it didnt resulting in a huge paradox like this. For movie goers the current plot is okayish but for scifi nerd this is unacceptable. The lost of one of the avenger is a pure tearjerk but the other one doesnt make any sense. It could have been done better with a different character.
Overall it is okay for entertainment if you dont think too much about it. But I feel unsatisfied with what they are doing. I really do feel it could be better.

It was incredible fan-fare. It had really basic and generic music, basic cinematography, basic plot, basic motivations. There was some cool action, but most of it was cut awfully. It was predictable as hell, the jokes were eh, the reveals and climaxes were eh. I knew what was going to happen and when to whom.It was just eh.

It's way too long. There's way too little fun or humor. Since it's yet-another-time-travel movie, it's not very interesting. Though they try to take a new spin on it (explicitly stating that "it doesn't work like in Back to the Future"), they end up with the same usual time-travel-silliness. The whole "multiverse and multi-timelines" is thus pretty inconsistent and weird. Sure, this is a comic-book movie, things don't make sense, but, still, they should at least be somewhat consistent.We never quite get why this chain of events is the only one out of 5 million that works and why had Dr Strange chosen it.And the whole "can't undo real deaths, only the Thanos-induced kind-of-deaths" is not explained (sure, it probably would not make sense anyway, but, still, it's kind of important and they don't even try).Thanos goes full-blown villain, which is not in line with his character.It also doesn't wrap up the story for all of the original Avengers. You kind of get why are the ones that are still here the "chosen ones" (clue: this is a business), but, still, it's a "conclusion of a story that is actually _not_ a conclusion of the whole story".Even for the ones that are done, their conclusions are not well done, are somewhat cliched, predictable and un-interesting. Iron-Man fairs best here, but, still underwhelming.On the plus side, from a general movie quality, this is better than Infinity War, it's better connected and the pace is better. Taking time-travel-silly aside, the story is OK. Although there a few "feminism in your face" moments, it doesn't go overboard.Acting is good enough, but, it could have been better. Some things didn't work, like Hemsworth's take on fat Thor, others were just not very good (ScarJo as the "no-nonsense leader of the free-decimated-universe" and Chris Evans' take on Charlie Sheen - like Anger Manager) while the rest were just OK - foremost RDJ. But, the thing is, we've seen these actors do better, it's bad they couldn't do it again.Bottom line, as a kind-of wrap-up for some characters, it's OK, worth a watch. But, on its own or if you're not into the characters that were "wrapped up", it's not.
This was the average superhero movie with an ending everyone expected,its a shame they did this to the best villain ever thanos

This movie is all That I wanted from a movie for a long time im still on the hypetrain eventhough I am a couple of tv show episodes behind but I try to clear everything up, cant wait until future project.

Perfect culmination of 11 years of 22 movies in a truly epic movie universe - MCU. After success of Infinity War expetactions for Endgame were very high and there wasn't surprise factor and Marvel srudios managed to pull it out. After IW there were million of questions in the air and this movie answered it all. We all can't get what we want from the ending (for example GoT finale) but for Endgame this wasn't the ending we need but the one we deserve. Every character got enough screen time, expect for Captain Marvel who was hyped for much more, but for sure she had important role and Brie Larson performance before she even knew how her character should do is truly what deserves round of applause. Hulk and Thor characters recieved some backflash from fans but I am very happy to see comic adaptationa of Professor Hulk and King Thor personas. Robert Downey Jr. delivered best performance of his career. There were deep scenes, scenes that left me crying out loud in the cinema, laughing out loud etc. Comedy and tragedy were very well combined and in balance - as all thing should be. Also there were some minor moments that set up the Phase 4 for MCU. Fan service was enjoyable. CGI was amazing and final battle was deserving to be compared to th LotR battle scenes. Plot was amazingly well adjusted, some fans didn't like time travel definition i believe because they didn't understand it, but it is not very hard to understand just pay attention. Also time travel is just a fiction so they can make as many rules as they want. It is a pure 10!

This could've been sooo much better, some great scenes and then the horrific route taken with the characters of Thor and Hulk! Some nice touches and fight scenes but left disappointed.
Totally agree with so many others that infinity war was the better movie.

The film starts to fall apart the more you think about it, but the conclusion to so many wonderful decade-spanning character arcs are so incredibly satisfying. There's so much to like about this film.

This film is not as good as many of the other Marvel movies (and certainly not the 'great' film reviewers are saying it is). It started off VERY slowly / took a while to get going. HATED what they did with Thor's character - making him a fat, lazy drunk. And I really think they should have killed off Hawkeye (who had become almost unlikable / a complete psychopath0 as opposed to Black Widow (who is a fan favorite). There were also a lot of inconsistencies with regards to bringing people back from the dead - they were brought back 5 years later, but they had not aged (while everyone else around them did age). Yet somehow, Peter Parker is still going to high school with all of the same high school friends who have miraculously NOT aged (unless they had all been deleted by Thanos, I find this highly unlikely). Captain Marvel, while very cool, was made to be too powerful. They also waited far too long to bring everyone back - not until the very end of the movie. So while it was 'enjoyable' (end fight scene was fantastic), there were many things that could have been done better.

I was slightly underwhelmed by the movie and I didn't cry at the ending at all. There was far too much sickly sweet scenes for my liking.The time travel bit left more questions than answers for me. The 2nd click mmmmI won't be going to see anymore Marvel movies apart from maybe Black Panther as I'm done

Honestly, no MCU movie has got me so emotionally involved in it's story and Endgame does just that. Not only do I get my CGI epic fight scene fix, I also felt closure with the first 6 avengers this is truly a masterpiece and a Must Watch for any movie buff, casual and child.

Like every time travel movie ever made Avengers Endgame established "rules" of time travel and then broke them repeatedly. Time travel movies never have sound logic and this isn't an exception. Like I said, it had some fun moments but overall it was meh.P.S. Fat Thor did nothing for the story line, it made his earth-shattering experience seem funny. Making him fat was good for one laugh and then it just got old, in my opinion.

It's going to be very difficult to top this, and it's also very difficult to express how amazing this film is without spoilers, so I will just keep it brief and say that you are doing yourself a disservice if you don't see this film. It is an epic event in every sense of the word, and you will never forget seeing this movie. The last hout will never leave your memory as long as you live. It is the epitome of action sacrifice and heroism and encapsulates the never ending battle of good versus evil. Go see this movie. See it twice.

This movie was weak, it's as simple as that:cons:thor's mental breakdown is a dumb decision, he didn't even get close to such state after his parent's death and now supposedly blames himself for not saving half of the humanity? such nonsense, and even if he was blaming i'm not sure playing console and drinking bear is like the quintessence of self blamecaptain marvel is for me completely unlikable character, with her always "resting bitchy face" mode on, laughable "I want to talk to manager" hairstyle and her crazy quazi feminism but more sexist attitude. What's more her power levels are so absurd that whenever she appears you can close your eyes, count to ten, cause no one stands a chance, so what's the point in watching it if the result is so obviouscap learning to use Thor's hammer in the middle of a battle, all of a sudden, and using it to it's full extent, at moments using it even better than Thor is pure absurd. Cap's just an enchanced human and him reaching power on par with Thor in matter of minutes is total nonsense.hulk is totally useless. Bannerohulk claims that he connected the best of both, but you can't really see him that usefull in battle, such a waste of character which was really enjoyable to watchthe scene where avengers mansion is bombarded and everyone walks out without a scratch is beyond absurd even for marvel standardsthe scene where in middle of probably most important battle for the whole universe, 8 or so female characters form a perfect majestic line is simply pathetic and cheap. It also strips away any feel of danger or gravity of this battle. It also stinks of really stupid propaganda / indoctrinationthanos's black order is killed so easilly whereas in the previous movie they fought as equall with the most powerfull characters of mcu, so now it's another example of lousy writingin the ending scenes, Thanos's inability to click his fingers although he had the gauntlet for quite a long time on, is unexplainable. It's hard to belive that he was perfectly stopped couple of times when it would take him less than a secondThanon's friendlyfire bombardment lacks any credibility as he didn't even manage to kill a single important oponent. If marvel gets rid of certain charaters than they could at least let some die, it would so much believable, watch and learn from GOT how battles should be done.the fact that Stark is able to use the gaunlet although he is a mere human with totally no powers is crazy. Quill and the rest of the guardians had to do it together to only survive the power surge one single infinity stone, where start used all and even lived to say his goodbyes. id-io-tic!I would also like to point that all of the characters that stories are ended are white, and all but one are male. Maybe it's a coincidence but I kinda doubt that.Most of the time the movie is really slow paced, although I can understand that that was in a way, a farewell for some characters so it's needed more dialogue than action.Majority of the jokes, as always, were pretty forced, akward or placed in a really strange spot like in the midst of extremly dangerous battle. It strips the feeling of any danger to the charactersThe movie was really predictible. Infinity war did a way better job is suprising the viewer.
Most likely I forgot to mention somePros:It was spectacular visually at some points.I am aware that it's an extremly hard task to close a longer than a decade of films, plot lines and stories. So I try to not be too harsh. But at the same time I feel that many choices were wrong, stupid or unsatisfying.
Overally this movie is way worse than the previous installment of Avengers, also it's probably my last marvel movie as I really don't see enough likeable and genuine characters left to form new fundaments for this universe, also I don't like how those movie become more and more about some propaganda or indotrination rather than pure well written fun, as it used to be.

What surprised me most about the movie is how funny it was. There were any number of hilarious moments that countered the profoundly sad moments. Rocket scammering away from chasing Asgardian soldiers, Stark and Nebula playing paper football, Thor playing video games and threatening a child player and on and on. Hilarious.I was concerned about how they would handle Captain Marvel because she is very powerful. I was really happy with her scenes as well as the one in which the Scarlett Witch showed up in super pissed off mode. I also stood up and cheered when Captain America wielded Mjolnir. The scene where EVERYBODY showed up via mystic portals was uber nerd paradise.I was a bit underwhelmed with how they handled Thor early on in the movie. While it was very funny, it was disappointing to see that he had let himself fall apart in an alcoholic stupor. I feel that his obligation to Odin to take care of people would have forced him to devote himself to that responsibility.Now for the deaths...first off, when I saw Black Widow and Hawkeye heading off to get the soulstone, I figured that was the end of Hawkeye. I never saw Black Widow dying as an even remote possibility but it does make a bit of sense. I was still sad to see her go.In retrospect, Tony Stark's sacrifice was foreshadowed heavilly in the scene where he cracked the time travel problem. He told Pepper that he could just throw it all away and live his life. He had to be true to his character's own purpose and be the hero. When he was dying, you could hear several people crying....loudly.We are going to see it again tomorrow. Well done Marvel. You really went for the head with great success.

The first 50 minutes set up the movie very well but the second act lacks urgency and focus. The movie comes to a halt and feels as if it's meandering between scenes, not knowing what to do and not being very entertaining. The movie is also highly predictable and somewhat ruins Thanos's character due to a strange character decision. Iron man is given a lot to work with, which is compelling, same with Hawkeye. The ending is somewhat satisfying but also cringe. Overall it is a fine movie, not offensively bad but certainly not as good as it's predecessor.

Before reading this, I just request you to take two minutes and think of best possible conclusion to this 22 movies saga. Thought of one? Now multiply the awesomeness of your ending by a 100 times and still this movie will surprise your assumptions! If a critic like me who just can't stop finding errors in a movie failed in finding big mistakes in this movie, I think you should believe this one is just perfect! Sure there were a few tweaks, but I am ready to ignore them seeing how smoothly the whole 3 hours of the runtime just passed by. I was literally sticked to my seat for 3 hours, even during the interval, I was like I want to see the whole movie in one length. Tell you the truth, I was not much impressed with Infinity wars or Ragnarok (not even mentioning captain marvel here xD), but Russo brothers just nailed this one. After waiting for 21 movies, we deserved a perfect end, and we got one. 10/10 from my side. If 21 movies lead to this, I am ready to watch another set of 21 for such a perfection!

I have never wrote a review about any movie I watch. I just feel that I have to document what just touched my heart. Growing up in the Middle East, specifically in Saudi Arabia, without cinema was hard for me. I remember I used to wait months after the movie comes out to watch it online. When I was in college, I used to travel to Bahrain to watch Marvel movies. I enjoyed watching all the movies. I have developed a strong connection with all the characters. I feel what they feel, I understand what they understand. It became a part of my life. My friends, even my close friends, used to make fun of me for watching superheroes movies. They always say that there is no story it is all CGI, what are you watching it for? They do not understand the creativity of developing characters and flashbacks, let alone understanding a complex plot with many planets and universes. I am so happy that I made it to the U.S and watched the movie in the opening day. With that said, Avengers: Endgame is one of the most epic movies I have ever seen. I laughed too loud, cried too hard, and smiled a lot. I will not write any spoilers, I am not that guy, but I wanted to share some of the feelings that I experienced in these epic three hours. The movie has everything perfect the writing, acting, and directing are all outstanding. If there is one wish that I could have in life is that watching this movie with someone I love who have the same admiration for Marvel movies. To the creators, actors and actresses, people behind the scene, and everyone participated in creating it I cannot thank you enough for what you have done. I know this is not a perfect review but I had to share it somehow.

I have loved the MCU for years but I am more than diappointed with this movie. #Superficially is felt similar to the others even though the plainly obvious addition of emotional scenes to wrap up a few of those characters was at times just too on the nose and I personally am not a fan of how it ended in general, there are just so many inconsistencies and plain errors in the timeline of the movie, that I guess are either going to be ignored or tried to be patched up after the fact.Fantasy only works for suspending reality if they stick to the rules they define for their own universe and Endgame dropped the ball multiple times on this. It's disappointing, that this is how it ends.

First of all, from a critics perspective, the movie had everything to be a complete success. The visuals were amazing, the soundtrack was a perfect underline to every scene and the plot contained several unexpected twists. However, the movie just didn't do it for me personally.Before I start complaining, I went in that movie with high expactations, due to it being the grand finale to an 11 years ongoing era, but was open for everything to happen.Except for just enough things that made me feel like it wasn't the finale I wished to see.Starting with the attack on Thanos in the first part of the movie. It was too fast and too easy to be the follow up of Infinity War. Thanos killed our beloved characters but the revenge for it just wasn't satisfiying and felt like they want to get rid of him as fast as possible just to bring his former conquerer self on screen to have a villain to fight.
It was surprising, but it wasn't a good surprise.Second, the humour felt kinda off. Don't get me wrong, the jokes were great and I laughed at some of them, but often they were misplaced. For such a serious situation, there were to many jokes.
Fat Thor was hilarious, but I would have liked this in the probably upcoming Asguardians of the galaxy movie, where they just chill in space and get fat, but not in the finale of an era.The solution for defeating Thanos, undo the snap and what they had to do for it were just to easy. I never had the feeling, that they were risking something. For every problem, there was a fast solution. There wasn't a moment where the stakes were high. It felt like "yeah just do it".Additionally, I think the Russo brothers went full safe mode with the happenings. Everything the fans wanted to see was in it. Wich sounds great, but there wasn't any real surprise. It felt like I knew exactly what will happen next and how the movie ends (just a note here: I tried to avoid any trailers or theories, so I went in that movie only with my own thoughts about it). It was indeed a good storyline, but way to predictable.Also, the movie was slow paced, but the important scenes, for example the comeback of all characters at the final battle, did not have enough time to breathe. There was so much happening at that battle, that every reunion was so fast and rushed. More time for it would have made it more emotional.These are just a few things that bothered me. Nevertheless there are a lot of good things as well.The movie took its time to have as much of a goodbye to the characters as possible.
The chemistry between the characters was on point.
The timetravels to the old movies were a great recap of what happened.
Tony's death and the funeral were emotional as hell.Overall, the movie just isn't the worthy finale for an unbelievebly well made cinematic universe. It did everything to be a good ending but lacked the surprises as a consequence. It is a must watch for fans, but as a movie itself it is by far not as good as Infinity War.
Great movie i almost cried and great ending to the series of movies

Original review -- 25/04/2019: deleted.New review -- 08/07/2019: Finally, the inner fanboyism in me has been tarnished. I ain't biased towards Marvel, the MCU for that matter, just because I love it as much as I do, so I put thought into any and all MCU reviews and give them unbiased, strong reviews and have reasons for my opinions. Not all MCU movies are great- to be honest there are some I don't even like that much, others I liked at first but have found myself loathing more as time goes on, the older I get. Take Captain Marvel, The Incredible Hulk, Iron Man 2, and Thor 2 for example; those are some I don't care for all that much. Endgame is in every sense of the word, fantastic. It's very well-executed and has so much emotion and captures the essence of each character, pushes boundaries and excels in cinematography, choreography, acting, directing (for the most part), chemistry, dialogue, action, narrative, and even development of character itself, with several story arcs concluding, rightfully so. To balance it out it has charm and comedy, which for the most part is funny and isn't overdone. But there are one or two jokes that feel forced or they're just unfunny. I couldn't care less about that awful newly-added "end-credit scene" - come on, it's unfinished, forced and terrible, and who are we kidding it's a deleted scene if anything. You're definitely up for it if you sit for the entire three hours but ultimately, I feel, it's worth it and the film showcases what Marvel- the MCU, rather, is, has done and has become as a landmark in superhero movies and film itself. That FORCED all-women, all-out "heroism" scene is absolute, utter cringe-central, and not because I "hate women," or am some neckbeard "anti-feminist," no. It's just unnecessary, unessential and completely redundant in every sense of the word, to say the least. Also, Thanos, character-wise, at least, isn't nearly as good as he is in Infinity War, although one could argue he's actually at his peak performance wise here as he's more vicious, younger, thus, arguably faster and more extreme in combat, all the while keeping his wisdom and personality. No gauntlet? No worries, he's still menacing and extremely powerful. Have to praise the performances in particular, that of Robert Downey Jr., Chris Hemsworth, Chris Evans, Paul Rudd, Mark Ruffalo, Scarlett Johansson, Jeremy Renner, and I still have to praise the voice-work, motion capture and portrayal of the character by Josh Brolin - I still thought he was excellent as Thanos and Thanos, while not as epic and captivating as he was in its predecessor, is still genuinely awesome. I still absolutely love the film, maybe not just AS much, but it's still a 10/10 from me, even after having seen it numerous, countless times by now. And they probably couldn't have killed off Iron Man in a more heroic, selfless, heartfelt way. Ridiculously good performances are seen at the end, and that battle at the end is still one of the most incredible things I've seen to date...ACT I -- INFINITY WAR > ENDGAMEACT II -- they're pretty much tied but I would have to give the upper hand to ENDGAMEACT III -- again, this is tough and they're almost tied, but I'll give ENDGAME the edge mainly thanks to, "Good, just as long as we're all in agreement..." in which battle ensues, Thor, Captain America and Iron Man vs Thanos, as well as the Avengers, Ravagers, armies of Wakanda and Asgard vs Thanos, the Black Order, Chitauri, etc, and because, well, Rogers wields Mjolnir and it's simply epic (and come on, that's pretty much everybody's favourite scene, is it not).Despite some minor issues, the film's still very emotionally-driven, heartfelt, shocking, sad, fun, thrilling, menacing, intriguing and uplifting all in one, with some of the best and most epic action sequences of any film I've seen...

Well, it finally happened: I got emotional during a Marvel movie. Sorry, not sorry. This film truly was a fitting conclusion to a decade of MCU films. While it was a classic action sequel, it was also filled with surprises, homages, laughs, and emotional moments. Unfortunately, that's a LOT to accomplish in one movie (hence the 3 hour runtime). Fortunately, almost all of it worked. They wanted to bring 22 movies to an epic climax...mission accomplished. I'm not sure that I would put this one alongside the best stand alone MCU chapters (Winter Soldier, Black Panther, Ragnarok, Iron Man, etc.), but it somehow pulled all those movies together in a pretty magical way. I complain a lot about the comic book-ification of film, but I can also recognize the accomplishment that is the MCU.
Save your money and time. This movie could've been done in a hour and half. Big disappointment compared to the other avengers movies.
